metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a no-cook dish called "Banh Mi," which serves 10 people. The main ingredients include Vietnamese rolls or hot dog rolls, shredded roast chicken, beetroot slaw, whole-egg mayonnaise, sriracha or chili sauce (optional), and long coriander sprigs. 

The directions outline two steps: first, splitting the bread rolls and spreading mayonnaise on the cut sides; second, filling the rolls with chicken and beetroot slaw, and optionally drizzling with chili sauce before serving with coriander sprigs. 

Key topics and entities include:
- Recipe title: Banh Mi
- Servings: 10
- Main ingredients: Vietnamese rolls, roast chicken, beetroot slaw, mayonnaise, chili sauce, coriander
- Preparation steps: Splitting rolls, spreading mayonnaise, filling with ingredients, serving.

__data__.text:
No-cook	chicken	Banh	mi
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
8	coles	bakery	vietnamese	rolls	or	hot	dogs	rolls
1	coles	rspca	approved	hot	roast	chicken,	coarsely
shredded
400	g	pkt	coles	beetroot	slaw
1	cup	(150g)	whole-egg	mayonnaise
2	tablespoons	sriracha	or	chilli	sauces	(optional)
16	long	coriander	sprigs,	trimmed
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Split	each	bread	roll	in	two	without	cutting	completely.	Spread	cut	sides
with	mayonnaise.
Step		2	Fill	with	chicken	and	beetroot	slaw.	Drizzle	with	chili	sauce,	if	desired.
Serve	with	coriander	sprigs.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Vietnamese Caramel Fish with Choy Sum," serving 10 people. Key components include:

**Ingredients:**
- Water (560ml and extra 80ml)
- White rice (250g)
- Fish sauce (2 tablespoons)
- Caster sugar (55g)
- Lemon juice (2 tablespoons)
- Vegetable oil (2 tablespoons)
- Spring onions (8, thinly sliced)
- Garlic cloves (6, crushed)
- Fresh red chillies (4, thinly sliced)
- White pepper (pinch)
- Firm white fish fillets (1000g, cut into pieces)
- Baby choy sum (4 cups, halved)
- Extra spring onion and chilli for serving

**Directions:**
1. Cook the rice by boiling water, adding rice, and simmering.
2. Prepare the caramel by heating sugar until it melts, then adding extra water, fish sauce, and lemon juice, cooking until thickened.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and cooking steps for a Vietnamese dish, emphasizing the preparation of rice and a caramel sauce for the fish.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	caramel	fish	with	choy	sum
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1130	1/2	560ml	(2	1/4	cups)	water
505	1/2	250g	(1	1/4	cups)	white	rice
160	2/3	80ml	(1/3	cup)	water,	extra
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
110	1/2	55g	(1/4	cup)	caster	sugar
2	tablespoons	lemon	juice
2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
8	spring	onions	(shallots),	thinly	sliced
6	garlic	cloves,	crushed
4	long	fresh	red	chillies,	thinly	sliced
pinch	of	white	pepper
1000	g	firm	white	fish	fillets,	cut	into	3-4cm	pieces
4	cups	baby	choy	sum,	halved	crossways
thinly	sliced	spring	onion	(shallots),	extra,	to	serve
thinly	sliced	long	fresh	red	chilli,	extra,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Bring	the	water	to	the	boil	in	a	saucepan	over	high	temperature.	Add	the
rice.	Reduce	heat	to	low.	Cover	and	simmer	for	12	minutes.	Reserve,	covered,
for	ten	minutes.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	heat	the	sugar	in	a	non-stick	frying	pan	over	medium	heat.
Cook,	swirling	the	pan	occasionally,	for	three	minutes	or	until	sugar	melts	and
caramelizes.	Remove	from	heat	and	stir	in	extra	water.	Place	over	medium	heat
and	stir	for	3-4	minutes	or	until	caramel	dissolves.	Add	fish	sauce	and	lemon
juice.	Bring	to	the	boil	and	simmer	for	1-2	minutes	or	until	thick	and	syrupy.

metadata.section_summary:

Entities identified include:

Overall, the section outlines a specific recipe preparation method in Vietnamese cuisine.

__data__.text:
Step		3	Heat	oil	in	a	wok	with	a	lid	over	medium	heat.	Add	the	spring	onion,
garlic,	and	chili.	Stir-fry	for	2	minutes	or	until	aromatic.	Stir	in	caramel	sauce.
Season	with	white	pepper.	Bring	to	boil.	Add	fish.	Simmer	for	1-2	minutes	or

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese beef and lemongrass stew, serving 10 people. Key topics and entities include:

- **Dish Name**: Vietnamese beef and lemongrass stew
- **Servings**: 10
- **Ingredients**: 
  - Gravy beef (cut into 4cm pieces)
  - Vegetable oil
  - Brown onions (finely chopped)
  - Lemongrass (finely chopped or paste)
  - Ginger (finely chopped)
  - Tomato paste
  - Garlic (finely chopped)
  - Whole star anise
  - Salt-reduced beef stock
  - Carrots (peeled and cut into 2cm pieces)
  - Turnip (peeled and cut into 2cm pieces)
  - Fish sauce
  - Dried rice noodles
  - Fresh coriander leaves and tender stems
  - Fresh basil leaves
  - Limes (cut into wedges)

- **Cooking Directions**:
  - Preheat oven and prepare beef by seasoning and browning it in a heavy-based saucepan.
  - Sauté onions, lemongrass, garlic, and ginger until the onion softens.

Overall, the section details the ingredients and initial steps for preparing the stew.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	beef	and	lemongrass	stew
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	pieces	gravy	Coles	Australian	No	Added	Hormones
Gravy	Beef	cut	into	4cm
1/4	cup	vegetable	oil	vegetable	oil	divided
2	onions	brown	onion	finely	chopped
1/4	cup	finely	chopped	lemongrass	or	lemongrass	paste
2	tablespoons	ginger	finely	chopped	peeled	ginger
1/2	cup	tomato	paste	(70g)	tomato	paste
2	tablespoons	garlic	finely	chopped	garlic
4	whole	star	anise
8	cups	beef	(1L)	salt-reduced	beef	stock
4	pieces	carrots	carrots	peeled	cut	into	2cm
2	pieces	turnip	peeled	cut	into	2cm
2	tablespoons	sauces	fish	sauce
375	cups	rice	noodles	dried	rice	noodles
1	cup	coriander	fresh	coriander	leaves	and	tender	stems
1	cup	basil	fresh	basil	leaves
2	limes	lime	cut	into	wedges
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Preheat	oven	to	160°C	(140°C	fan-forced).	Season	beef	generously	with
salt	and	pepper.	Heat	a	huge	heavy-based	ovenproof	saucepan	over	medium-high
heat.	Add	1	tablespoon	of	the	oil	and	half	the	beef.	Cook,	turning	as	needed,	for
6	mins	or	until	beef	is	brown.	Transfer	beef	to	a	plate.	Repeat	with	remaining	oil
and	beef.
Step		2	Reduce	heat	to	medium.	Add	onion,	lemongrass,	garlic	and	ginger	to	the
pan.	Cook,	stirring	frequently,	for	6	mins	or	until	onion	softens.

__data__.text:
Step		3	Add	the	tomato	paste.	Cook,	stirring	frequently,	for	2	mins	or	until	the
paste	starts	to	adhere	to	base	of	pan.	Stir	in	star	anise	and	stock,	scraping	up
brown	bits	from	base	of	pan.	Return	beef	to	the	pan.	Bring	to	a	simmer.	Cover
and	transfer	to	the	oven.	Bake	for	2	1/2	hours.
Step		4	Add	carrots	and	turnip.	Bake,	uncovered,	for	30	mins	or	until	beef	is
fork-tender.	Skim	off	any	fat	that	rises	to	the	very	best.	Stir	in	fish	sauce.	Season.
Step		5	In	a	huge	pot	of	salted	boiling	water,	cook	noodles	for	4	mins	or	until	al
dente.	Drain.	Divide	noodles	among	6	bowls.	Spoon	stew	over	noodles	and	serve
with	coriander,	basil	and	lime.

The section provides a recipe for Vegetarian Pho, a Vietnamese noodle soup, serving 10 people. Key ingredients include rice vermicelli noodles, firm tofu, baby pak choy, bean sprouts, fresh Vietnamese mint, red chili, and various spices such as cinnamon, star anise, coriander seeds, and black peppercorns. The recipe outlines the preparation of the broth using aromatic spices and vegetables, specifically mentioning the use of dried shiitake mushrooms and vegetable stock. The directions detail the initial steps for creating the broth, emphasizing the importance of toasting the spices to enhance flavor. 

Main Topics:

- Cooking directions for broth preparation

Entities:

__data__.text:
Vegetarian	pho
	
Servings:	10

bean	sprouts,	to	serve
fresh	vietnamese	mint	sprigs,	to	serve
sliced	fresh	red	chilli,	to	serve
hot	chilli	sauce,	to	serve
lime	wedges,	to	serve

4	whole	star	anise
2/3	cup

10	cm-piece	ginger,	peeled,	halved	horizontally
41	1/2	20g	(3/4	cup)	sliced,	dried	shiitake	mushrooms
6	3l	(12	cups)	massel	vegetables	liquid	stock
light	soy	sauce,	to	taste
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	To	help	make	the	broth,	place	the	cinnamon,	star	anise,	cloves,	coriander

Transfer	mixture	to	a	bit	of	muslin	cloth	and	tie	up	with	kitchen	string	to	produce

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese-inspired broth dish prepared in a slow cooker. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Cooking Method**: The dish is made using a slow cooker, with specific steps outlined for preparation and cooking.
2. **Ingredients**:
   - Onion mixture
   - Muslin pouch (likely containing spices)
   - Mushrooms
   - Stock
   - Noodles
   - Pak Choy
   - Tofu
   - Bean sprouts
   - Mint
   - Sliced chili
   - Soy sauce
   - Chili sauce
   - Lime wedges
3. **Cooking Steps**:
   - Step 1: Lightly char the onion mixture.
   - Step 2: Combine the onion mixture, muslin pouch, mushrooms, and stock in the slow cooker and cook on high for 4 hours.
   - Step 3: Soften the noodles in boiling water and stir in soy sauce before serving.
   - Step 4: Add pak choy and tofu to the slow cooker, cook until tender, and serve the dish with toppings and condiments.

Overall, the section outlines a detailed cooking process for a flavorful broth dish, highlighting the use of fresh ingredients and specific cooking techniques.

__data__.text:
3-5	minutes	or	until	lightly	charred.
Step		2	Place	the	onion	mixture,	muslin	pouch	and	mushroom	in	a	6L	slow
cooker.	Add	the	stock.	Cover	and	cook	on	High	for	4	hours	to	build	up	the
flavours.
Step		3	Five	minutes	prior	to	the	broth	is	ready,	place	the	noodles	in	a	sizable
heatproof	bowl	and	cover	with	boiling	water.	Reserve	for	five	minutes	to	soften.
Drain	well.	Remove	spice	pouch	from	broth.	Stir	in	soy	sauce,	to	taste.
Step		4	Add	the	pak	choy	and	tofu	to	the	slow	cooker.	Cover.	Cook	on	High	for
5-10	minutes	or	before	Pak	Choy	is	tender.	Divide	the	noodles	and	soup	among
serving	bowls.	Top	with	bean	sprouts,	mint	and	sliced	chilli.	Serve	with	chilli
sauce	and	lime	wedges.

__data__.text:
Nuoc	Cham	(Vietnamese	Sauce)
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3	1/2	tablespoons	lime	juice
2	1/2	tablespoons	fish	sauces,	or	more	to	taste
1	tablespoon	water
1	1/5	red	chile	pepper,	thinly	sliced,	or	more	to	taste
2	1/2	tablespoons	white	sugar,	or	more	to	taste
1	tablespoon	garlic,	thinly	sliced

together	in	a	bowl.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Nuoc Cham," a dipping sauce commonly used for Vietnamese spring rolls. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe title: Nuoc Cham
- Cuisine: Vietnamese
- Serving size: 10

**Ingredients:**
- Long red chillies
- Grated palm sugar
- Limes
- Garlic cloves
- Fish sauce
- Rice wine vinegar

**Directions:**
1. Prepare a paste using chilies and garlic, then mix in sugar.
2. Combine the paste with lime juice, fish sauce, vinegar, and water, and shake until sugar dissolves.

**Entities:**
- Recipe components (ingredients and steps)
- Cooking techniques (pounding, mixing)
- Measurements (tablespoons, cups)

__data__.text:
Nuoc	cham	for	Vietnamese	spring	rolls
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
4	long	red	chillies,	chopped
2	tablespoons	grated	palm	sugar
4	limes,	juiced
2	garlic	cloves,	peeled
1/2	cup	fish	sauces
2	tablespoons	rice	wine	vinegar
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Pound	chilies	and	garlic	in	a	mortar	and	pestle	to	create	a	paste.	Add
sugar	and	pound	until	combined	(see	shortcut).	Transfer	to	a	screw-top	jar.
Step		2	Add	1/4	cup	lime	juice,	fish	sauce,	vinegar,	and	2	tablespoons	cool	water.
Shake	until	sugar	dissolves.	Serve.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Roasted Pork Banh Mi," a Vietnamese sandwich. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Recipe Title:** Roasted Pork Banh Mi
2. **Servings:** 6
3. **Ingredients:** 
   - Daikon radishes
   - Carrots
   - Mayonnaise
   - Hoisin sauce
   - Seasoned rice vinegar
   - Sriracha hot sauce
   - French sandwich roll
   - Cooked pork roast
   - Smooth pate
   - English cucumbers
   - Jalapeno pepper
   - Cilantro leaves

4. **Directions:** 
   - Preheat oven and prepare baking sheet.
   - Toss and marinate vegetables.
   - Mix mayonnaise and sauces.
   - Prepare the French roll for filling.
   - Spread the mayo mixture on the roll.

**Entities:**
- **File Information:** 
  - Page label: 116
  - File name: vietnames-cookbook.pdf
  - File path: data\vietnames-cookbook.pdf
  - File type: application/pdf
  - File size: 1,481,387 bytes
  - Creation date: November 5, 2024
  - Last modified date: November 5, 2024

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and steps required to prepare a traditional Vietnamese Banh Mi sandwich featuring roasted pork.

__data__.text:
Roasted	Pork	Banh	Mi
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
5	tablespoons	julienned	(2-inch	matchsticks)	daikon
radishes
5	tablespoons	julienned	(2-inch	matchsticks)	carrots
5	tablespoons	mayonnaise
1	3/16	teaspoons	hoisin	sauces,	or	to	taste
1	tablespoon	seasoned	rice	vinegar
1	3/16	teaspoons	sriracha	hot	sauces,	or	more	to	taste
1	1/5	crusty	french	sandwich	roll
4	3/4	ounces	cooked	pork	roast,	thinly	sliced
2	1/3	ounces	smooth	pate,	thinly	sliced
7	1/5	thin	spears	english	cucumbers,	diced
7	1/5	thin	slices	jalapeno	pepper,	or	more	to	taste
5	tablespoons	cilantro	leaves
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Preheat	oven	to	400	degrees	F.	Line	a	baking	sheet	with	aluminum	foil.
Step	2	Toss	julienned	daikon	and	carrot	with	seasoned	rice	vinegar	to	coat	well.
Let	sit	until	veggies	get	slightly	limp,	15	to	20	minutes.	Drain	and	reserve	or
refrigerate.
Step	3	Mix	the	mayonnaise,	hoisin	sauce,	and	sriracha	in	a	little	bowl.
Step	4	Split	the	French	roll	sufficient	so	that	you	can	open	it	such	as	a	book.	If
you	want,	pull	out	a	few	of	the	bread	from	the	very	best	half	to	raised
accommodate	the	filling.
Step	5	Spread	the	inside	surfaces	of	the	roll	liberally	with	the	mayo	mixture.

Beef	Meatballs	(Vietnamese)
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	pounds	lean	ground	beef

1/2	cup	roughly	chopped	cilantro
1	1/2	tablespoons	peeled	and	finely	chopped	ginger
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
6	tablespoons	garlic,	finely	chopped

1	1/2	green	chile	pepper,	chopped

3	tablespoons	soy	sauce

and	chile	pepper	in	a	food	processor	and	blend	until	mixed	and	minced.	Transfer
to	a	bowl.	Coat	fingers	and	palms	lightly	with	oil	and	scoop	tablespoons	of	beef
mixture	to	create	equal-sized	meatballs	and	place	them	on	a	plate.
Step	2	Heat	oil	in	a	deep	pan	over	medium	heat.	Add	meatballs;	cover	and	cook
five	minutes.	Turn	meatballs	over,	cover	pan,	and	cook	until	golden	brown,

The section provides a recipe for Pho Ga Soup, which serves 8 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Pho Ga Soup
- Servings: 8
- Ingredients: A list of ingredients including vegetable oil, yellow onions, baby bella mushrooms, water, rice stick noodles, garlic, chicken bouillon, cooked chicken breasts, green onions, cilantro, bean sprouts, limes, and Sriracha hot sauce.
- Directions: Step-by-step instructions for preparing the soup, including sautéing vegetables, boiling the mixture, and adding chicken and garnishes.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: vegetable oil, yellow onions, baby bella mushrooms, water, rice stick noodles, garlic, chicken bouillon, cooked chicken breasts, green onions, cilantro, bean sprouts, limes, Sriracha hot sauce.
- Cooking Steps: Heating oil, sautéing, boiling, simmering, and serving.
- Cooking Terms: Sauté, simmer, garnish. 

Overall, the section outlines a detailed recipe for making Pho Ga Soup, including necessary ingredients and cooking instructions.

__data__.text:
Pho	Ga	Soup
	
Servings:	8
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
1	1/3	small	yellow	onions,	chopped
1	1/3	(8-ounce)	packages	baby	bella	mushrooms,
chopped
10	2/3	cups	water
1	1/3	(6.75	ounce)	package	rice	stick	noodles	(such	as
maifun®)
5	1/2	tablespoons	garlic,	minced
3	1/2	tablespoons	chicken	bouillon
3	1/3	breast,	bone	removeds	cooked	chicken	breasts,
shredded
5	1/3	eaches	green	onions,	chopped
1/2	cup	chopped	fresh	cilantro
2	2/3	cups	bean	sprouts
1	1/3	limes,	sliced	into	wedges
1	1/2	dashes	sriracha	hot	sauces,	or	more	to	taste
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Heat	vegetable	oil	in	a	sizable	saucepan	over	medium-high	heat;	saute
onion,	mushrooms,	and	garlic	until	tender,	5	to	ten	minutes.	Add	water,	rice
noodles,	and	chicken	bouillon	to	onion	mixture;	bring	to	a	boil.	Reduce	heat	to
low.
Step	2	Mix	shredded	chicken,	green	onions,	and	cilantro	into	soup;	simmer	for
five	minutes	more.	Transfer	soup	to	serving	bowls	and	top	with	bean	sprouts,	a
squeeze	of	lime	juice,	and	Sriracha	hot	sauce.

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe title: Slow-cooker Vietnamese Braised Beef (Bo Kho)
- Servings: 10
- Ingredients list: Includes beef brisket, carrots, garlic, lemongrass, tomato paste, fish sauce, Chinese five-spice powder, beef stock, dried rice noodles, bean sprouts, red onion, fresh mint, fresh coriander, chili oil, and lime wedges.
- Directions: Two main steps for preparation, including cooking the beef mixture in a slow cooker and preparing the noodles.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: Beef brisket, carrots, garlic, lemongrass, tomato paste, fish sauce, five-spice powder, beef stock, rice noodles, bean sprouts, red onion, mint, coriander, chili oil, lime.
- Cooking methods: Slow cooking (LOW and HIGH settings), boiling noodles.
- Serving suggestions: Toppings and accompaniments for the dish.

__data__.text:
Slow-cooker	Vietnamese	braised	beef	(Bo	Kho)
													
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	2/5	kg	beef	brisket
4	carrots,	quartered	lengthways,	cut	into	3cm
lengths
4	garlic	cloves,	crushed
6	stalks	lemongrass,	finely	chopped
2/3	cup	tomato	paste
1/4	cup	fish	sauces
2	teaspoons	chinese	five-spice	powder
6	cups	salt-reduced	beef	stock
400	packets	g		dried	rice	noodles
6	cups	bean	sprouts,	trimmed
1	small	red	onion,	thinly	sliced
fresh	mint	leaves,	to	serve
fresh	coriander	leaves,	to	serve
chilli	oil,	to	serve
lime	wedges,	to	serve
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Trim	beef	of	most	fat	and	sinew.	Cut	into	3cm	pieces.	Place	beef,	carrot,
garlic,	lemongrass,	tomato	paste,	sh	sauce,	five-spice,	and	stock	in	the	slow
cooker.	Cover.	Cook	on	LOW	for	4	hours	(or	on	HIGH	for	2	hours).
Step	2	Cook	noodles	following	packet	directions.	Drain.	Divide	noodles	among
serving	bowls.	Top	with	beef	mixture.	Sprinkle	with	bean	sprouts,	onion,	mint,
and	coriander.	Drizzle	with	chili	oil.	Serve	with	lime	wedges.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	beef	salad
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1000	g	beef	rump	steak,	excess	fat	trimmed
200	g	dried	rice	vermicelli	noodles
200	g	snow	peas,	trimmed,	halved
1	cup	fresh	coriander	leaves
2/3	cup	fresh	mint	leaves,	torn
2	lebanese	cucumbers,	peeled	lengthways	into	ribbons
4	shallots,	ends	trimmed,	thinly	sliced
2	small	carrots,	peeled,	cut	into	matchsticks
101	1/3	50g	(2/3	cup)	bean	sprouts,	trimmed
120	g	asian	leafy	salad	mixes	(see	note)
2	small	fresh	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
3	tablespoons	fresh	lime	juice
3	tablespoons	peanut	oil
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces	(see	note)
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Preheat	a	barbecue	grill	or	chargrill	on	medium-high.	Cook	the	beef	for	4
minutes	each	side	for	medium	or	until	cooked	to	your	liking.	Thinly	slice.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	place	the	noodles	and	snow	peas	in	a	large	heatproof	bowl.
Cover	with	boiling	water.	Set	aside	for	5	minutes	or	until	noodles	are	tender.
Drain.	Use	kitchen	scissors	to	cut	the	noodles	into	short	lengths.	Return	the
noodles	and	snow	peas	to	the	bowl.
Step		3	Add	the	beef,	cucumber,	coriander,	mint,	shallot,	carrot,	bean	sprouts	and
salad	mix	to	the	bowl.	Toss	to	combine.

__data__.text:
Pickled	Daikon	Radish	and	Carrot
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3/4	cup	distilled	white	vinegar
1	1/2	small	carrots,	peeled	and	cut	into	matchsticks
1	1/2	daikon	radishes,	peeled	and	cut	into	matchsticks
6	tablespoons	white	sugar
3	tablespoons	chopped	fresh	cilantro

Directions
Step	1	Heat	vinegar	and	sugar	in	a	saucepan	over	low	heat	until	sugar	is
dissolved.	Remove	from	heat,	and	refrigerate	to	cool.	Place	daikon	and	carrot	in
a	glass	jar	with	the	cilantro	and	hot	peppers.	Pour	the	cooled	vinegar	mixture
over,	submerging	the	vegetables.	Cover	and	refrigerate	for	at	least	4	hours,	or
overnight.

__data__.text:
Quick	sticky	salmon	skewers	with	kale	slaw
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1000	g	coles	deli	salmon	fillets,	cut	into	3cm	pieces
1	1/2	tablespoons	ginger,	finely	grated
6	spring	onions,	cut	into	3cm	lengths
350	g	pkt	kantong	sticky	chicken	teriyaki	sauce
800	g	pkt	coles	brand	kale	coleslaw	salad	kit
cooked	rice	vermicelli	noodles,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Preheat	a	grill	on	medium-high.	Line	a	baking	tray	with	foil.
Step		2	Combine	the	salmon,	teriyaki	sauce,	and	ginger	in	a	huge	bowl.	Toss	to
mix.	Thread	the	salmon	and	spring	onion	evenly	onto	12	soaked	bamboo
skewers.	Place	the	skewers	on	the	lined	tray.
Step		3	Cook	the	skewers	under	the	grill	for	2	mins	each	side	or	until	lightly
charred	and	just	cooked	through.	Remove	from	heat	and	transfer	to	a	clean	plate.

the	seed	mix	from	the	coleslaw	packet.	Top	the	coleslaw	with	the	salmon

The section provides a recipe for "Salmon, Quinoa, and Veggie Rice Paper Rolls." It includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Recipe Title**: Salmon, Quinoa, and Veggie Rice Paper Rolls
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Cooked quinoa (110g or 3/4 cup)
   - Salt-reduced gluten-free tamari
   - Rice paper wrappers (12 round, 20cm)
   - Snow peas (200g, trimmed and shredded)
   - Red capsicum (1, deseeded and thinly sliced)
   - Smoked salmon (190g can, drained and flaked)
   - Carrots (2, peeled and cut into matchsticks)
   - Mint leaves (24)
4. **Directions**:
   - Step 1: Mix quinoa with tamari.
   - Step 2: Soak rice paper, fill with quinoa and other ingredients, and roll.
   - Step 3: Keep rolls covered with a damp cloth.
   - Step 4: Serve with extra tamari.

5. **File Information**:
   - Page Label: 135
   - File Name: vietnames-cookbook.pdf
   - File Path: data\vietnames-cookbook.pdf
   - File Type: application/pdf
   - File Size: 1,481,387 bytes
   - Creation Date: November 5, 2024
   - Last Modified Date: November 5, 2024

Overall, the section focuses on a healthy and gluten-free recipe for rice paper rolls featuring salmon and quinoa, along with preparation instructions.

__data__.text:
Salmon,	quinoa	and	vegie	rice	paper	rolls
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
221	1/2	110g	(3/4	cup)	cooked	quinoa	(see	tip)
2	teaspoons	salt-reduced	gluten-free	tamari,	plus	extra,
to	serve
12	round	20cm	rice	paper	wrappers
200	g	snow	peas,	trimmed,	shredded
1	red	capsicum,	deseeded,	thinly	sliced
190	cans	g		smoked	salmon,	drained,	flaked
2	carrots,	peeled,	cut	into	long	thin	matchsticks
24	mint	leaves
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Place	the	quinoa	in	a	bowl	with	the	tamari	and	toss	to	mix.
Step		2	Soak	a	rice	paper	wrapper	in	warm	water	for	10-20	seconds.	Transfer	to	a
clean	tea	towel	to	soak	up	excess	water.	Place	a	small	amount	of	the	quinoa	in
the	center	of	the	rice	paper.	Top	with	one-sixth	of	the	salmon,	snow	pea,
capsicum,	carrot	and	2	of	the	mint	leaves.
Step		3	Roll-up	to	enclose	the	filling.	Place	the	roll	under	a	slightly	damp	cloth
(to	avoid	blow-drying).	Continue	with	remaining	rice	paper	and	fillings,	putting
rolls	under	damp	cloth.
Step		4	Serve	with	extra	tamari,	if	desired.

2	long	fresh	red	chilli,	halved,	deseeded,	finely	chopped
2	garlic	cloves,	finely	chopped
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	To	help	make	the	nuoc	cham,	combine	fish	sauce,	lime	juice,	water,	sugar,
chilli	and	garlic	in	a	little	bowl.	Stir	until	sugar	dissolves.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for making a type of Vietnamese pancake. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Ingredients**: 
   - Flour
   - Coconut milk
   - Water
   - Turmeric
   - Sugar
   - Salt
   - White pepper
   - Onion
   - Pork
   - Oil
   - Prawns
   - Bean sprouts
   - Lettuce
   - Mint

2. **Preparation Steps**:
   - **Step 2**: Combine and season the flour mixture, then refrigerate.
   - **Step 3**: Stir-fry onion and pork in a non-stick frying pan.
   - **Step 4**: Cook the pancake batter, add pork, prawns, and bean sprouts, then fold and serve.

3. **Cooking Techniques**: 
   - Stir-frying
   - Pan-frying
   - Covering and resting the batter

4. **Serving Suggestions**: The pancakes are served with lettuce and mint, and cut into quarters.

Overall, the section outlines a cooking process for a savory pancake dish, highlighting the ingredients, preparation, and serving methods.

__data__.text:
Step		2	Stir	the	combined	flour,	coconut	milk,	water,	turmeric,	sugar	and	salt	in	a
medium	bowl.	Season	with	white	pepper.	Cover	and	place	in	the	fridge	for	one
hour	or	overnight	to	rest.
Step	3	Heat	a	20cm	(base	measurement)	non-stick	frying	pan	over	high
temperature.	Add	1	tablespoon	of	oil	and	heat	until	just	smoking.	Stir-fry	the
onion	and	pork	for	five	minutes	or	until	golden.	Transfer	to	a	plate.	Wipe	the	pan
clean.
Step		4	Lightly	brush	pan	with	one-quarter	of	remaining	oil.	Heat	over	medium-
high	heat	until	smoking.	Add	one-quarter	of	the	flour	mixture	and	tilt	pan,
swirling	batter	to	cover	base	and	slightly	up	the	medial	side.	Cook	for	five
minutes	or	until	underside	is	golden.	Place	one-quarter	of	pork	mixture	and	one-
quarter	of	the	prawn	on	half	the	pancake.	Top	with	one-quarter	of	bean	sprouts.
Fold	to	enclose.	Transfer	to	a	plate	and	cover	with	foil.	Repeat	with	the	rest	of
the	oil,	flour	mixture,	pork	mixture,	prawn	and	bean	sprouts.	Cut	each	pancake
into	quarters	and	serve	with	lettuce	and	mint.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Salt and Pepper Squid," serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Ingredients**: 
   - Cleaned calamari (400g)
   - Sea salt
   - Ground white pepper
   - Potato flour
   - Chinese five spice
   - Vegetable oil (for frying)
   - Long red chili
   - Green onions

2. **Directions**: 
   - Preheat the oven and prepare the calamari by cutting and scoring.
   - Combine the dry ingredients in a bag and prepare for frying.
   - Fry the calamari in batches until golden and keep warm in the oven.
   - Serve garnished with sliced chili and green onions.

3. **Cooking Method**: 
   - Shallow frying and oven warming.

4. **Temperature Settings**: 
   - Oven temperature: 160°C/140°C fan-forced.

Overall, the section details the preparation and cooking process for a popular seafood dish, highlighting the ingredients and steps involved.

__data__.text:
Salt	and	pepper	squid
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
4	2	(400g)	cleaned	calamari	hoods
2	tablespoons	sea	salt
1	tablespoon	ground	white	peppers
2/3	cup	potato	flour
1	teaspoon	chinese	five	spice
vegetable	oil,	for	shallow	frying
2	long	red	chilli,	thinly	sliced
2	green	onions,	thinly	sliced	diagonally
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Preheat	oven	to	160°C/140°C	fan-forced.	Cut	calamari	in	two.	Score
inside	flesh	and	cut	into	3cm	pieces.
Step	2	Combine	flour,	salt,	pepper,	and	Chinese	five-spice	in	a	snap-lock	bag.
Add	enough	oil	to	a	big,	deep	frying	pan	to	come	5mm	up	the	side	of	the	pan.
Heat	over	medium-high	heat.
Step	3	Put	in	a	third	of	the	calamari	to	flour	mixture.	Toss	to	coat,	shaking	off
excess	mixture.	Cook,	turning,	for	2	minutes	or	until	lightly	golden.	Transfer	to	a
greased	baking	tray.	Place	in	oven	to	keep	warm	while	cooking	the	remaining
calamari.	Serve	sprinkled	with	chili	and	green	onion.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese dish that involves the following main topics and entities:

1. **Ingredients**: 
   - Vinegar
   - Lemongrass
   - Garlic
   - Fish sauce
   - Sugar

   - Mint
   - Peanuts
   - Shallots
   - Coriander
   - Nuoc cham (a dipping sauce)

2. **Preparation Steps**:
   - **Step 1**: Pickling vegetables with vinegar and refrigerating.
   - **Step 2**: Marinating beef with lemongrass, garlic, fish sauce, sugar, and pepper, then refrigerating.
   - **Step 3**: Preparing noodles by soaking in boiling water, draining, and mixing with fresh vegetables and herbs.
   - **Step 4**: Stir-frying the marinated beef in a wok and transferring it to a bowl.
   - **Step 5**: Combining the hot beef mixture with the noodle mixture and garnishing with peanuts, shallots, and coriander, served with Nuoc cham.

Overall, the section outlines a detailed process for preparing a flavorful Vietnamese dish, emphasizing marination, cooking techniques, and presentation.

__data__.text:
vinegar.	Cover.	Refrigerate	for	2	hours	or	overnight,	if	time	permits.
Step	2	Meanwhile,	combine	lemongrass,	garlic,	fish	sauce,	sugar	and	pepper	in	a
glass	or	ceramic	dish.	Add	beef.	Toss	to	coat.	Cover.	Refrigerate	for	2	hours,	if
time	permits.
Step		3	Place	noodles	in	a	sizable	heatproof	bowl.	Cover	with	boiling	water.
Reserve	for	ten	minutes	or	until	softened.	Drain.	Rinse	under	cool	water.	Drain.
Place	noodles	in	a	sizable	serving	dish.	Drain	pickled	vegetables.	Add	lettuce,
cucumber,	pickled	vegetables	and	mint	to	noodles.
Step		4	Heat	a	wok	over	medium-high	heat.	Add	2	teaspoons	oil.	Swirl	to	coat.
Add	half	the	beef	mixture.	Stir-fry	for	2-3	three	minutes	or	until	browned.
Transfer	to	a	bowl.	Cover.	Repeat	with	remaining	oil	and	beef.
Step		5	Spoon	hot	beef	mixture	over	noodle	mixture.	Sprinkle	with	peanuts,
shallots	and	coriander.	Serve	with	Nuoc	cham.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Banh Mi Burgers, which serves 8 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Recipe Title**: Banh Mi Burgers
2. **Servings**: 8
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Vegetables: cucumbers, green onions, carrots
   - Condiments: rice vinegar, mirin, white sugar, tamari sauce, chili garlic sauce, toasted sesame oil, fish sauce
   - Main Ingredient: ground pork
   - Herbs: fresh basil, fresh mint
   - Buns: sesame seed hamburger buns
4. **Preparation Steps**:
   - Step 1: Mix vegetables and refrigerate.
   - Step 2: Prepare pork mixture, form patties, and refrigerate.

Overall, the section details the ingredients and steps required to prepare Banh Mi Burgers, highlighting the use of fresh vegetables, pork, and specific sauces to create the dish.

__data__.text:
Banh	Mi	Burgers
	
Servings:	8
	
	
Ingredients
	
2/3	cup	chopped	cucumbers,	seeded	if	large
5	1/2	tablespoons	thinly	sliced	green	onions
5	1/2	tablespoons	chopped	carrots
2/3	cup	rice	vinegar
2	1/2	tablespoons	mirin	(japanese	rice	wine)
1	1/3	teaspoons	white	sugar
2	2/3	pounds	ground	pork
2	1/2	tablespoons	tamari	sauce
1	1/2	tablespoons	chili	garlic	sauce
1	1/2	tablespoons	toasted	sesame	oil
1	1/3	teaspoons	mirin	(japanese	rice	wine)
1	1/2	tablespoons	grated	fresh	ginger
1	1/3	teaspoons	fish	sauces
8	eaches	sesame	seed	hamburger	buns
1	1/3	teaspoons	chopped	fresh	basil
1	1/3	teaspoons	chopped	fresh	mint
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	In	a	bowl,	mix	together	the	cucumber,	green	onion,	carrot,	rice	vinegar,	2
tablespoons	of	mirin,	and	sugar	before	the	mixture	is	well	blended.	Refrigerate	3
hours	to	overnight.
Step	2	Place	the	pork	in	a	mixing	bowl,	and	lightly	match	tamari	sauce,	sesame
oil,	1	teaspoon	of	mirin,	ginger,	chili	garlic	sauce,	and	fish	sauce.	Divide	the
meat	into	6	equal	parts,	and	form	each	part	right	into	a	patty.	Refrigerate	for	one
hour.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Vermicelli rice (2 1/2 ounces)
   - Rice wrappers (10, 8.5-inch diameter)
   - Fresh Thai basil (1 tablespoon, chopped)
   - Fresh mint leaves (3 1/2 tablespoons, chopped)
   - Cooked shrimp (10 large, peeled, deveined, and halved)
   - Fresh cilantro (3 1/2 tablespoons, chopped)
   - Lettuce (5 1/2 tablespoons, chopped)
   - Fish sauce (1 1/2 tablespoons)
   - Water (5 tablespoons)
   - Fresh lime juice (2 1/2 tablespoons)
   - Minced garlic (1 tablespoon)
   - White sugar (2 1/2 tablespoons)
   - Garlic chili sauce (5/8 teaspoon)
   - Hoisin sauce (3 1/2 tablespoons)
   - Finely chopped peanuts (1 1/4 teaspoons)

4. **Directions**:
   - Step 1: Cook vermicelli in boiling water until al dente, then drain.
   - Step 2: Soften rice wrapper in warm water, fill with shrimp, vermicelli, herbs, and lettuce, then roll tightly.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and steps needed to prepare Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls, emphasizing fresh herbs and shrimp as key components.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Fresh	Spring	Rolls
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	1/2	ounces	vermicelli	rice	vermicelli
10	rice	eaches	rice	wrappers	(8.5	inch	diameter)
1	tablespoon	basil	chopped	fresh	Thai	basil
3	1/2	tablespoons	mint	leaves	chopped	fresh	mint	leaves
10	shrimp	large	cooked	shrimp	-	peeled	deveined	and
cut	in	half
3	1/2	tablespoons	cilantro	chopped	fresh	cilantro
5	1/2	tablespoons	lettuce	chopped
1	1/2	tablespoons	sauces	fish	sauce
5	tablespoons	water
2	1/2	tablespoons	lime	juice	fresh	lime	juice
1	tablespoon	garlic	minced
2	1/2	tablespoons	sugar	white	sugar
5/8	teaspoon	chili	sauce	garlic	chili	sauce
3	1/2	tablespoons	hoisin	sauce	hoisin	sauce
1	1/4	teaspoons	peanuts	finely	chopped	peanuts
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Bring	a	medium	saucepan	of	water	to	boil.	Boil	rice	vermicelli	three	to
five	minutes,	or	until	al	dente,	and	drain.
Step	2	Fill	a	huge	bowl	with	tepid	to	warm	water.	Dip	one	wrapper	into	the
warm	water	for	1	second	to	soften.	Lay	wrapper	flat.	In	a	row	over	the	center,
place	2	shrimp	halves,	a	small	number	of	vermicelli,	basil,	mint,	cilantro	and
lettuce,	leaving	about	2	inches	uncovered	on	each	side.	Fold	uncovered	sides
inward,	then	tightly	roll	the	wrapper,	beginning	by	the	end	with	the	lettuce.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Rice Noodles with Lemongrass & Beef," serving 10 people. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Ingredients**: A detailed list of ingredients required for the dish, including beef, garlic, fish sauce, lemongrass, rice vermicelli noodles, various vegetables (cucumbers, carrots), fresh herbs (basil, mint, coriander), and seasonings (canola oil, lime juice, sugar, chili, bean sprouts, peanuts).
2. **Directions**: Step-by-step instructions for preparing the dish, including marinating the beef and preparing the noodles.

**Entities:**
- **Dish Name**: Rice Noodles with Lemongrass & Beef
- **Servings**: 10
- **Key Ingredients**: Beef rump steak, garlic, fish sauce, lemongrass, rice vermicelli noodles, cucumbers, carrots, basil, mint, coriander, canola oil, brown onions, lime juice, sugar, red chili, bean sprouts, roasted peanuts.
- **Preparation Steps**: Marinating beef, cooking noodles, and mixing ingredients. 

Overall, the section focuses on a Vietnamese recipe that combines various fresh ingredients and flavors.

__data__.text:
Rice	noodles	with	lemon	grass	&	beef
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
700	g	beef	rump	steak,	trimmed,	thinly	sliced
2	garlic	cloves,	crushed
160	2/3	80ml	(1/3	cup)	fish	sauces
2	lemons	grass,	pale	section	only,	finely	chopped
400	g	rice	vermicelli	noodles
2	large	lebanese	cucumbers,	halved,	thinly	sliced
2	carrots,	peeled,	cut	into	thin	matchsticks
2	cups	fresh	basil	leaves
2	cups	fresh	mint	leaves
2	cups	fresh	coriander	leaves
2	tablespoons	canola	oil
2	brown	onions,	halved,	thinly	sliced
160	2/3	80ml	(1/3	cup)	fresh	lime	juice
3	tablespoons	white	sugar
2	long	fresh	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
71	35g	(1/2	cup)	bean	sprouts,	trimmed
110	2/3	55g	(1/3	cup)	roasted	unsalted	peanuts,	coarsely
chopped
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Combine	beef,	garlic,	1	tablespoon	of	fish	sauce,	and	2	teaspoons	of
lemongrass	in	a	bowl.	Cover	and	place	in	the	fridge	for	ten	minutes	to	marinate.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	prepare	the	noodles	following	packet	directions.	Drain	and
refresh	under	cold	running	w	ater.	Transfer	to	a	huge	bowl.	Add	the	cucumber,
carrot,	basil,	mint	and	coriander	and	toss	to	mix.

__data__.text:
Step		3	Heat	a	wok	over	high	temperature.	Add	the	oil	and	heat	until	just
smoking.	Stir-fry	half	the	beef	and	half	the	onion	for	2-3	minutes	or	until
browned	and	cooked	through.	Transfer	to	a	plate.	Repeat	with	remaining	beef
and	onion,	reheating	the	wok	between	batches.
Step		4	Combine	the	lime	juice,	sugar,	chilli	and	remaining	lemon	grass	and	fish
sauce	in	a	jug.	Add	half	the	lime	juice	mixture	to	the	noodle	mixture	and	toss	to

and	peanut.	Drizzle	over	the	rest	of	the	lime	juice	mixture.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese fish curry, detailing the ingredients and cooking instructions. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese Fish Curry
- Servings: 10
- Ingredients List: Includes peanut oil, lemongrass, curry powder, chicken-style liquid stock, basa fillets, coconut milk, broccoli, caster sugar, fish sauce, fresh coriander, and steamed white rice.
- Cooking Directions: Step-by-step instructions for preparing the dish, including heating oil, cooking lemongrass and curry powder, adding coconut milk and stock, cooking fish and broccoli, and serving with rice.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: Peanut oil, lemongrass, curry powder, chicken-style liquid stock, basa fillets, coconut milk, broccoli, caster sugar, fish sauce, fresh coriander, white rice.
- Cooking Techniques: Heating, stirring, boiling, reducing heat, cooking, serving.
- Cuisine: Vietnamese.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	fish	curry
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	tablespoons	peanut	oil
2	stem	lemons	grass,	pale	section	only,	finely	chopped
2	tablespoons	curry	powder
500	250ml	(1	cup)	massel	chicken	style	liquid	stock
1200	g	basa	fillets,	cut	into	4cm	pieces
800	cans	ml	coconut	milk
500	g	broccoli,	cut	into	florets
1	1/2	tablespoons	caster	sugar
1	1/2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
fresh	coriander	sprigs,	to	serve
steamed	white	rice,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Heat	oil	in	a	wok	over	medium-high	heat.	Cook	the	lemongrass,	stirring,
for	1	minute.	Add	the	curry	powder	and	cook	for	30	seconds	or	until	aromatic.
Step		2	Add	the	coconut	milk	and	stock.	Bring	to	the	boil.	Reduce	heat	to
medium-low	and	cook,	stirring	often,	for	a	quarter-hour	or	before	mixture
thickens	slightly.
Step	3	Add	fish	and	broccoli.	Cook	for	three	minutes	or	until	fish	is	cooked
through.	Stir	in	sugar	and	fish	sauce.	Top	with	coriander.	Serve	with	rice.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Banh Mi," a Vietnamese sandwich, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Recipe Title**: Banh Mi
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Ginger
   - Rice wine vinegar
   - Caster sugar
   - Telegraph cucumber
   - Soy sauce
   - Carrots
   - Sweet chili sauce
   - Garlic
   - Skinless chicken thighs
   - Olive oil
   - Baguette
   - Whole-egg mayonnaise
   - Coriander
   - Long red chili

4. **Directions**:
   - Step 1: Prepare a dressing with ginger, vinegar, sugar, and salt; toss in cucumber and carrot, and let sit.
   - Step 2: Marinate chicken in a mixture of soy sauce, sweet chili sauce, and garlic.
   - Step 3: Cook the marinated chicken in a frypan until done, then shred.
   - Step 4: Drain the pickled vegetables.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and steps needed to prepare Banh Mi, highlighting the preparation of pickled vegetables and marinated chicken.

__data__.text:
Banh	mi
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	tablespoons	finely	grated	ginger
1/2	cup	rice	wine	vinegar
1	1/2	tablespoons	caster	sugar
1	telegraph	cucumber,	finely	shredded
1/2	cup	soy	sauce
2	carrots,	finely	shredded
1/2	cup	sweet	chilli	sauces
2	garlic	cloves,	finely	chopped
1000	g	skinless	lilydale	free	range	chicken	thighs
2	tablespoons	olive	oil
2	baguette,	cut	into	4
2/3	cup	whole-egg	mayonnaise
1/2	cup	coriander	sprigs,	leaves	picked
2	long	red	chilli,	seeds	removed,	thinly	sliced
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Combine	ginger,	vinegar,	sugar,	and	1	teaspoon	salt	in	a	bowl.	Toss	the
cucumber	and	carrot	through	the	dressing	and	reserve	for	30	minutes.
Step	2	Combine	soy	sauce,	sweet	chili	sauce,	and	garlic	in	a	bowl	and	add	the
chicken,	embracing	coat.	Cover	and	marinate	in	the	fridge	for	thirty	minutes.
Step		3	Heat	the	oil	in	a	frypan	over	medium	heat.	Drain	the	chicken	and	cook
for	4-5	minutes	each	side	until	cooked	through.	Cool	slightly,	then	shred	with	2
forks.
Step		4	Drain	the	pickled	vegetables.

The section provides a recipe for "Stir-fried Rice Noodles and Beef with Nuoc Cham Marinated Mango." It includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Recipe Title**: Stir-fried Rice Noodles and Beef with Nuoc Cham Marinated Mango
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Reduced-salt soy sauce
   - Brown sugar
   - Garlic
   - Coarsely ground black pepper
   - Fresh ginger
   - Eye fillet steak
   - Fish sauce
   - Lime (zest and juice)
   - Long red chili
   - Firm ripe mangoes
   - Canola oil
   - Pad Thai rice noodles
   - Carrots
   - Fresh basil leaves
   - Spring onions
4. **Directions**:
   - Marinate beef slices in a mixture of soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, and black pepper.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and initial steps for preparing a flavorful stir-fried dish featuring beef and rice noodles, complemented by a mango salad.

__data__.text:
Stir-fried	rice	noodles	and	beef	with	nuoc	cham
marinated	mango
																											
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1/2	cup	reduced-salt	soy	sauce
2	tablespoons	brown	sugar
1/2	cup	garlic,	finely	chopped
1	teaspoon	coarsely	ground	black	pepper
8	cm	piece	(20g)	fresh	ginger,	peeled,	finely	grated
1000	g	eye	fillet	steak,	fat	and	sinew	trimmed,	meat	cut
into	3/4	cm	thick	slices
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
zest	of	1	lime,	plus	1	tablespoon	juice
1	long	red	chilli,	finely	chopped	(1/2	tablespoon)
2	firm	ripe	mangos,	peeled,	pitted,	thinly	sliced
1	1/2	tablespoons	canola	oil
400	g	pad	thai	rice	noodles
2	medium	carrots,	peeled,	cut	into	long	matchstick-size
strips
1	cup	small	fresh	basil	leaves
4	spring	onions,	thinly	sliced	on	a	sharp	diagonal
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	In	a	medium	bowl,	mix	the	soy	sauce,	brown	sugar,	ginger,	garlic,	and
black	pepper.	Marinate	beef	slices	in	2	tablespoons	of	mixture	for	approximately
10	mins.	In	a	little	bowl,	mix	the	fish	sauce,	lime	zest	and	juice,	and	chilli	and
fold	in	the	mango.	Marinate	for	approximately	10	mins.

__data__.text:
Step		2	Meanwhile,	bring	a	huge	pot	of	water	to	a	boil	over	high	temperature.
Add	noodles	and	cook	for	5	mins,	or	until	al	dente.	Drain	and	rinse	under	cool
water	until	cool.	Drain	and	reserve.
Step		3	Heat	a	Curtis	Stone	Everyday	Wok	over	high	temperature	for	2	mins,	or
until	it	is	extremely	hot	and	a	wisp	of	white	smoke	comes	off	it.	Add	1	teaspoon
of	the	oil,	then	add	the	beef	slices.	Cook	for	1	min,	or	before	beef	starts	to
caramelise	but	continues	to	be	rare.	Transfer	beef	slices	and	any	juices	to	a	plate.
Step		4	Stir	the	remaining	1	teaspoon	oil	and	the	carrot	into	the	hot	wok,	then	stir
in	remaining	sauce,	beef,	any	juice	from	the	beef,	and	2	tablespoons	of	water.
Add	noodles	and	stir-fry	for	1	min,	or	before	noodles	are	tender	and	carrot	is
merely	tender.
Step		5	Divide	noodle	mixture	among	4	bowls.	Arrange	beef	slices	over	noodles.
Serve	the	marinated	mango	alongside	and	spoon	remaining	marinade	from	the
mangoes	around	the	noodles.	Sprinkle	with	basil	and	spring	onions	and	serve
immediately.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a dish called "Spicy Green Beans," which serves 6 people. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Recipe Title:** Spicy Green Beans
2. **Servings:** 6
3. **Ingredients:** 
   - Vegetable oil
   - Yellow onion
   - Minced garlic
   - Soy sauce
   - Nuoc mam (Vietnamese fish sauce)
   - Fresh green beans
   - Water
   - Tomatoes
   - Salt and pepper

4. **Directions:** 
   - Heat oil and sauté onion and garlic.
   - Add green beans and season with soy sauce and fish sauce.
   - Simmer with water until beans are tender.
   - Stir in tomatoes and season with salt and pepper before serving.

**Entities:**
- **Dish Type:** Stir-fry
- **Cuisine:** Vietnamese
- **Key Ingredients:** Green beans, soy sauce, nuoc mam, tomatoes

Overall, the section outlines a simple stir-fry recipe highlighting the use of fresh green beans and traditional Vietnamese flavors.

__data__.text:
Stir-Fry	Spicy	Green	Beans
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3/4	teaspoon	vegetable	oil
3/4	yellow	onion,	chopped
1	1/2	teaspoons	minced	garlic
6	tablespoons	soy	sauce
4	1/2	tablespoons	nuoc	mam	(vietnamese	fish	sauce)
1	1/2	pounds	fresh	green	beans,	trimmed	and	halved
6	tablespoons	water
1	1/2	medium	tomatoes,	diced
1	1/2	pinches	salt	and	pepper	to	taste
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Heat	the	oil	in	a	skillet	over	medium	heat.	Add	the	onion	and	garlic;	cook
and	stir	for	some	minutes	then	add	the	green	beans.	Stir	to	coat	with	the	flavors
in	the	pan.	Season	with	soy	sauce	and	fish	sauce	and	let	simmer	for
approximately	2	minutes,	stirring	occasionally.	Pour	in	the	water	and	let	simmer
for	approximately	ten	minutes,	or	until	green	beans	are	tender.	Stir	in	tomato	and
season	with	salt	and	pepper	before	serving.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Sweet and Spicy Chicken," specifically chicken wings, serving 10 people. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Ingredients**: The recipe lists the necessary ingredients, including chicken wings, fish sauce, caster sugar, garlic, vegetable oil, cornflour, red chili, and fresh coriander leaves.
2. **Directions**: The cooking process is outlined in four steps, detailing preparation, marination, frying, and baking of the chicken wings.

**Entities:**
- **Dish Name**: Sweet and Spicy Chicken
- **Servings**: 10
- **Key Ingredients**: Chicken wings, fish sauce, sugar, garlic, vegetable oil, cornflour, red chili, coriander
- **Cooking Techniques**: Marinating, frying, baking
- **Temperature**: 160°C/140°C fan-forced for baking

Overall, the section focuses on a specific recipe, including preparation steps and cooking instructions for a flavorful chicken dish.

__data__.text:
Sweet	and	spicy	chicken
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
18	9	(750g)	chicken	wings
2/3	cup	fish	sauces
2/3	cup	caster	sugar
10	garlic	cloves,	finely	chopped
vegetable	oil,	for	shallow	frying
1	1/3	cups	cornflour
1/4	cup	vegetable	oil
2	long	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
fresh	coriander	leaves,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Using	sharp	kitchen	scissors,	remove	and	discard	wing	tips	from	each
chicken	wing.	Cut	wings	in	two	at	the	joint.	Place	fish	sauce,	sugar	and	half	the
garlic	in	a	glass	or	ceramic	dish.	Add	chicken.	Turn	to	coat.	Refrigerate	chicken
for	at	least	2	hours,	tossing	in	marinade	occasionally.
Step		2	Heat	2	tablespoons	of	oil	in	a	little	frying	pan	over	medium-high	heat.
Add	remaining	garlic.	Cook	for	1	minute	or	until	golden	and	fragrant.	Transfer
to	a	plate	lined	with	paper	towel.
Step		3	Preheat	oven	to	160°C/140°C	fan-forced.	Remove	chicken	from
marinade.	Reserve	marinade.	Place	chicken	on	a	baking	tray	lined	with	paper
towel.	Pat	chicken	dry	with	paper	towel.
Step		4	Add	enough	oil	to	a	big,	deep	frying	pan	to	come	5mm	up	side	of	pan.
Heat	over	medium-high	heat.	Place	cornflour	in	a	sizable	snap-lock	bag.	Add
half	the	chicken.	Toss	to	coat,	shaking	off	excess.	Add	the	chicken	to	the	pan.

Cook	for	2	minutes	each	side	or	until	golden.	Transfer	to	a	greased	baking	tray.
Repeat	with	remaining	chicken	and	cornflour.	Bake	for	ten	minutes	or	until
cooked	through.
Step		5	Meanwhile,	place	reserved	marinade	in	a	little	saucepan	over	medium-

Drizzle	over	sauce.	Sprinkle	with	fried	garlic,	chilli	and	coriander.	Serve.

The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese dish called "Thit Bo Xao Dau," which serves 6 people. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Recipe Title:** Thit Bo Xao Dau
2. **Servings:** 6
3. **Ingredients:** 
   - Garlic (minced)
   - Ground black pepper
   - Vegetable oil
   - Cornstarch
   - Sirloin tips (thinly sliced)
   - Onion (thinly sliced)
   - Fresh green beans (washed and trimmed)
   - Chicken broth
   - Soy sauce

4. **Directions:** 
   - Mixing the marinade for the beef.
   - Cooking the beef in a wok.
   - Sautéing onions and green beans, then combining with the beef and broth.

**Entities:**

- **Measurements:** Tablespoons, teaspoons, pounds, cups.
- **Cooking Equipment:** Mixing bowl, wok.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and step-by-step directions for preparing the dish.

__data__.text:
Thit	Bo	Xao	Dau
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	tablespoons	garlic,	minced
3/8	teaspoon	ground	black	pepper
1	1/2	teaspoons	vegetable	oil
1	1/2	teaspoons	cornstarch
1	1/2	pounds	sirloin	tips,	thinly	sliced
4	1/2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
3/4	onion,	thinly	sliced
3	cups	fresh	green	beans,	washed	and	trimmed
6	tablespoons	chicken	broth
1	1/2	teaspoons	soy	sauce
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	In	a	sizable	mixing	bowl,	combine	garlic,	black	pepper,	cornstarch,	and	1
teaspoon	vegetable	oil.	Add	beef,	and	mix	well.
Step	2	In	a	sizable	wok,	heat	2	tablespoons	oil	over	high	temperature	for	just	one
minute.	Add	meat;	cook	and	stir	for	approximately	2	minutes,	or	until	beef	starts
to	brown.	Transfer	beef	to	a	sizable	bowl,	and	reserve.
Step	3	Heat	remaining	1	tablespoon	oil	in	wok.	Add	onion;	cook	and	stir	until
tender.	Mix	in	green	beans,	and	add	broth.	Cover,	and	reduce	heat	to	medium.
Simmer	for	4	to	five	minutes,	or	until	beans	are	tender	crisp.	Stir	in	soy	sauce
and	beef.	Cook,	stirring	constantly,	for	one	or	two	2	minutes,	or	until	heated
through.

The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese beef lettuce wraps, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Ingredients**: 
   - 700g beef rump steak (thinly sliced)
   - 2 garlic cloves (crushed)
   - 1/4 cup fish sauce
   - 2 tablespoons peanut oil
   - 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
   - 200g dried rice vermicelli noodles
   - 55g (1/3 cup) finely chopped peanuts
   - 1 cup fresh coriander sprigs
   - 1 long fresh red chili (seeded and thinly sliced)
   - 2 red coral lettuce (leaves separated)

2. **Directions**: 
   - Marinate the beef with garlic and fish sauce.
   - Soak the noodles in boiling water.
   - Stir-fry the beef in batches and combine with lime juice, peanuts, coriander, and chili.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese beef rolls, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Beef Rolls
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Vegetable oil
   - Australian beef porterhouse steaks (4 x 250g)
   - Rustic baguette (2 pieces, cut into 4)
   - Whole egg mayonnaise (1 cup or 150g)
   - Carrots (2, cut into matchsticks)
   - Spring onions (4, halved)
   - Baby cos lettuce leaves (8)
   - Coriander sprigs (1 cup)
   - Long red chilli (2, sliced)
   - Soy sauce (2 tablespoons)

4. **Directions**:
   - Step 1: Cook the steaks in oil, rest, and slice.
   - Step 2: Prepare the baguettes with mayonnaise and fill them with the cooked ingredients, serving with soy sauce.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and preparation steps for making Vietnamese beef rolls.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	beef	rolls
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
4	x	250g	coles	australian	beef	porterhouse	steaks
2	coles	bakery	rustic	baguette,	cut	into	4	pieces
1	cup	(150g)	whole	egg	mayonnaise
2	carrots,	peeled,	cut	into	long	matchsticks
4	spring	onions,	trimmed,	halved
8	baby	cos	lettuce	leaves
1	cup	coriander	sprigs
2	long	red	chilli,	thinly	sliced
2	tablespoons	soy	sauce
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Heat	oil	in	a	large	frying	pan	on	medium	heat.	Cook	steaks	for	3	mins
each	side	or	until	cooked	to	your	liking.	Transfer	to	a	plate	and	cover.	Rest	for	5
mins.	Slice	thinly.
Step		2	Split	baguettes	in	half	without	cutting	all	the	way	through.	Spread
mayonnaise	inside	baguettes.	Divide	lettuce,	carrot,	steak,	onion,	coriander	and
chilli	among	baguettes.	Serve	drizzled	with	soy	sauce.

The section describes a cooking process for a Vietnamese dish that involves the following main topics and entities:

1. **Ingredients and Seasoning**: The recipe includes garlic, fish sauce, pepper, pork, carrot, coriander, mint, and chili.

2. **Cooking Method**: The pork is simmered on low heat for 1.5 hours until tender, with the sauce becoming thick and glossy.

3. **Preparation of Pickled Carrot**: The carrot is drained of its pickling liquid and mixed with fresh herbs (coriander, mint) and chili.

4. **Serving Instructions**: The cooked pork is divided into serving bowls and topped with the pickled carrot and herb salad, and it is suggested to serve the dish with steamed rice.

Overall, the section focuses on the preparation and serving of a Vietnamese pork dish accompanied by a fresh herb salad and pickled carrots.

Vietnamese	Chicken	and	Long-Grain	Rice
Congee
																											
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
cup	rice	⅛	uncooked	jasmine	rice
1	1/2	whole	chicken	(2.5	pound)	chicken
1	1/2	stalks	lemons	lemon	grass	chopped
1	1/2	tablespoons	salt	salt	or	to	taste
4	1/2	pieces	ginger	root	(2	inch)	fresh	ginger	root
6	tablespoons	cilantro	chopped	cilantro
cup	chives	⅛	chopped	fresh	chives
1	1/2	teaspoons	black	pepper	ground	black	pepper	to
taste
1	1/2	limes	lime	cut	into	8	wedges
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Place	chicken	in	a	stock	pot.	Pour	in	enough	water	to	cover	chicken.	Add
ginger,	lemon	grass,	and	salt;	bring	to	a	boil.	Reduce	heat,	cover,	and	gently
simmer	for	one	hour	to	at	least	one	1	1/2	hours.
Step	2	Strain	broth,	and	return	broth	to	stock	pot.	Let	chicken	cool,	then	remove
bones	and	skin,	and	tear	into	bite-size	pieces;	reserve.
Step	3	Stir	rice	into	broth,	and	bring	to	a	boil.	Reduce	heat	to	medium,	and	cook
for	thirty	minutes,	stirring	occasionally.	If	necessary,	adapt	to	water	or	additional
salt.	The	congee	is	performed	but	could	be	left	to	cook	yet	another	45	minutes
for	better	consistency.
Step	4	Ladle	congee	into	bowls,	and	top	with	chicken,	cilantro,	chives,	and
pepper.	Squeeze	lime	juice	to	taste.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese Chicken Cabbage Salad, serving 4 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese Chicken Cabbage Salad
- Servings: 4
- Ingredients: 
  - Cabbage (2 1/2 cups, cored and shredded)
  - Onions (1 1/3 medium, halved and thinly sliced)
  - Olive oil (2 1/2 tablespoons)
  - Salt and pepper (to taste)
  - Shredded cooked chicken breasts (1 1/3 cups)
  - Lemon juice (2 tablespoons, or to taste)

**Directions:**
- Combine cabbage, onions, and chicken in a bowl.
- Toss with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and add lemon juice to taste.
- Refrigerate for at least 4 hours to enhance flavor.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: Cabbage, onions, olive oil, salt, pepper, chicken, lemon juice.
- Cooking Method: Tossing and refrigerating. 
- Preparation Time: Minimum of 4 hours for marinating. 

Overall, the section emphasizes the preparation of a salad that combines fresh ingredients and highlights the importance of marinating for flavor development.

essential	olive	oil	until	everything	is	lightly	coated.	Season	with	salt	and	pepper
and	continue	steadily	to	toss	while	adding	lemon	juice.	Add	enough	lemon	juice

flavors	mesh	together	and	the	better	it	tastes!

**Summary:**

**Main Topic:**
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese chicken soup with green noodles, detailing the ingredients and cooking instructions.

**Entities:**
1. **Servings:** 10
2. **Ingredients:**
   - Vegetable oil
   - Brown onions
   - Garlic
   - Water
   - Cinnamon sticks
   - Ginger
   - Star anise
   - Dried red chillies or chilli flakes
   - Whole free-range chicken
   - Fish sauce
   - Pak choy or bok choy
   - Limes (juice only)

3. **Cooking Steps:**
   - Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger in oil.
   - Add water and spices, bring to a boil, then add chicken.
   - Simmer chicken for 50-60 minutes for tenderness.
   - Skim impurities from the surface.

**File Information:**
- **Page Label:** 195

- **File Type:** application/pdf

- **Last Modified Date:** November 5, 2024

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	chicken	soup	with	green	noodles
													
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
2	large	brown	onions,	diced
2/3	cup	garlic,	finely	diced
6	l	water
6	cinnamon	sticks,	broken	in	half
2	large	knob	of	ginger,	peeled,	finely	diced	or	minced
12	star	anise
8	dried	red	chillies,	broken	in	half,	if	you	can	find	or
1/2-1	teaspoon	dried	chilli	flakes
2	large	whole	free-range	chicken
1	cup	fish	sauces,	plus	extra	to	taste
8	cups	thickly	shredded	pak	choy	or	bok	choy
4	–	3	limes,	juice	only
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Place	a	huge	saucepan	or	stockpot	over	medium-high	temperature,	add
oil,	when	oil	is	hot	add	onion	and	sauté	for	approximately	3	-	five	minutes,	until
onions	are	translucent	and	soft.	Add	garlic	and	ginger	and	continue	steadily	to
cook	for	1	-	2	minutes.
Step		2	Add	water,	cinnamon,	star	anise	and	dried	chillies	to	the	saucepan.	Bring
to	the	boil.	Once	water	is	boiling,	add	the	chicken.	The	quantity	of	water	should
just	cover	the	chicken,	put	in	a	little	more	if	you	need	to.	Allow	water	come	to	a
gentle	simmer	then	switch	off	the	heat	completely	and	invite	the	chicken	to	sit	in
the	water	for	approximately	50-60	minutes.	(This	enables	the	chicken	meat	to	be
tender	and	moist)	Skim	surface	of	any	impurities	or	excess	oil	that	involves	the
surface.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a step-by-step guide for preparing a chicken soup using a reserved stock. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Chicken Preparation**: The chicken is boiled until firm, then removed from the water, and the meat is shredded after cooling.
2. **Stock and Spices**: The stock is either strained or spices are added directly, including chillies, diced onion, ginger, and garlic.
3. **Cooking Process**: The stock is brought to a boil, impurities are skimmed off, and diced greens (including stalks) are added.
4. **Final Seasoning**: Shredded chicken is added back to the stock, seasoned with fish sauce, and fresh lime juice is squeezed over the soup before serving.

Overall, the section emphasizes the preparation and seasoning of a flavorful chicken soup.

chicken	and	shred.
Step		4	At	this	time	you	can	either	choose	the	spices	or	strain	the	stock,	I	love	to
just	choose	the	spices	and	keep	carefully	the	chillies	in	the	soup	combined	with

requires	more	fish	sauce.	Squeeze	fresh	lime	juice	over	soup	when	serving	in	big

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Aromatic Lamb Chops, serving 6 people. Key components include:

**Ingredients:**
- 18 lamb loin chops (1-inch thick)
- Garlic (sliced and powder)
- White sugar
- Black pepper and chili powder
- Fresh lime juice and soy sauce
- Olive oil
- Fresh cilantro
- Lime and lemon wedges

**Directions:**
1. Season lamb chops with garlic, spices, sugar, lime juice, soy sauce, and olive oil; refrigerate overnight.
2. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C) and let the lamb sit at room temperature.
3. Roast the lamb for about 20-30 minutes to achieve desired doneness, then garnish with cilantro and serve with lemon and lime juice.

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe preparation
- Cooking instructions
- Ingredients list

**Entities:**
- Vietnamese cuisine
- Lamb chops
- Cooking techniques (roasting, marinating)

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Aromatic	Lamb	Chops
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
18	(3	ounce)	lamb	loin	chops	(1-inch	thick)
2	1/2	tablespoons	garlic,	sliced
1	3/16	teaspoons	garlic	powder,	or	to	taste
2	1/2	tablespoons	white	sugar
1	pinch	freshly	ground	black	pepper	to	taste
1	pinch	chili	powder
1	tablespoon	fresh	lime	juice
1	tablespoon	soy	sauce
2	1/2	tablespoons	olive	oil
5	tablespoons	chopped	fresh	cilantro
2	2/5	wedge	(blank)s	limes	wedges
2	2/5	wedge	(blank)s	lemons	wedges
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Place	the	lamb	chops	right	into	a	roasting	pan,	and	season	evenly	with	the
garlic,	garlic	powder,	chili	powder,	sugar,	salt,	and	pepper.	Drizzle	with	1
tablespoon	of	lime	juice,	soy	sauce	and	essential	olive	oil.	Cover	and	refrigerate
overnight.
Step	two	2	Preheat	the	oven	to	400	degrees	F	(200	degrees	C).	Permit	the	lamb
to	stand	at	room	temperature	as	the	oven	preheats.
Step	3	Roast	uncovered	in	the	preheated	oven	to	your	desired	amount	of
doneness,	about	20	minutes	for	medium,	or	thirty	minutes	for	done	well.	Garnish
with	a	sprinkle	of	cilantro	and	squeeze	lemon	and	lime	juice	outrageous	before
serving.

metadata.section_summary:
**Summary:**

- **Recipe Title:** Prawns with Tomato & Tamarind
- **Servings:** 10

**Ingredients:**
- Passata (tomato pasta sauce) - 185ml (3/4 cup)
- Massel chicken-style liquid stock - 125ml (1/2 cup)
- Caster sugar - 2 tablespoons
- Fish sauce - 1 1/2 tablespoons
- Tamarind puree - 2 tablespoons
- Vegetable oil - 2 tablespoons
- Garlic cloves - 4, finely chopped
- Fresh red chili - 2, finely chopped
- Green prawns - 1600g, peeled (tails intact) and deveined
- Steamed rice (for serving)
- Fresh coriander sprigs (for serving)

**Directions:**
1. Combine passata, stock, tamarind, sugar, and fish sauce in a jug.
2. Heat oil in a wok, stir-fry garlic and chili until aromatic, then add prawns and stir-fry until they change color.
3. Add the passata mixture and simmer until thickened. Serve over rice and garnish with coriander. 

**Key Topics:**
- Cooking method: Stir-frying and simmering
- Cuisine: Vietnamese
- Main ingredients: Prawns, tomato, tamarind, and spices
- Serving suggestion: With steamed rice and fresh coriander.

__data__.text:
Prawns	with	tomato	&	tamarind
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
371	1/2	185ml	(3/4	cup)	passata	(tomato	pasta	sauce)
251	125ml	(1/2	cup)	massel	chicken	style	liquid	stock
2	tablespoons	caster	sugar
1	1/2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
2	tablespoons	tamarind	puree
2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
4	garlic	cloves,	finely	chopped
2	long	fresh	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
1600	g	green	prawns,	peeled	leaving	tails	intact,
deveined
steamed	rice,	to	serve
fresh	coriander	sprigs,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Combine	the	passata,	stock,	tamarind,	sugar,	and	fish	sauce	in	a	jug.
Step	2	Heat	the	oil	in	a	wok	over	medium-high	heat	until	just	smoking.	Stir-fry
the	garlic	and	chili	for	1	minute	or	until	aromatic.	Add	the	prawns.	Stir-fry	for	1-
2	minutes	or	before	prawns	just	change	color.
Step		3	Add	passata	mixture.	Simmer	for	3-5	minutes	or	until	mixture	thickens.
Divide	rice	among	serving	plates.	Top	with	the	prawn	mixture	and	coriander.

Vietnamese	chicken	noodle	salad
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
6	small	(about	500g)	single	chicken	breasts	fillets
300	g	rice	stick	noodles
2	tablespoons	rice	vinegar
2	tablespoons	sweet	chilli	sauces
1	1/2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
1/4	cup	fresh	lime	juice

200	100g	(2	cups)	finely	shredded	chinese	cabbage

diagonally

Step	1	Place	chicken	in	a	medium	saucepan	and	cover	with	cool	water.	Place
over	high	temperature	and	bring	to	the	boil.	Reduce	heat	to	low	and	simmer,

Vietnamese	coconut-poached	chicken	and	rice-noodle
salad
																											
Servings:	10

4	lilydale	free	range	chicken	breasts
10	cm	ginger,	thinly	sliced

1/4	cup	lime	juice
1/4	cup	palm	sugar
800	cans	ml	coconut	milk

400	g	rice	stick	noodles

2	long	red	chilli,	seeded,	thinly	sliced	lengthways
1	cup	(80g)	salted	roasted	peanuts,	coarsely	chopped
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Combine	the	chicken,	ginger,	lemongrass,	and	coconut	milk	in	a	medium-
size	saucepan	over	medium	heat.	Bring	it	to	a	simmer.	Reduce	heat	to	low	and
cook,	turning	occasionally,	for	10	minutes	or	until	chicken	is	only	cooked
through.	Remove	from	heat.	Reserve	for	quarter-hour	to	cool	slightly.	Transfer	to
a	bowl.	Cover	with	plastic	wrap	and	place	in	the	fridge	for	just	one	hour	to	chill.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Crispy	Fish
	
Servings:	4
	
	
Ingredients
	
4	(1	pound)	whole	red	snapper
2	pinches	sea	salt	to	taste

seeded	and	coarsely	chopped
3/4	cup	water
1/4	cup	asian	fish	sauces	(nam	pla)

2. **Servings**: 10

400	g	fine	rice	flour
600	ml	coconut	milk
500	ml	water

800	g	pork	fillet	or	loin,	sliced	into	thin	strips
1/2	cup	garlic,	finely	diced

2	cups	bean	sprouts,	washed

2	long	red	chilli,	thinly	sliced	(optional)
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	To	create	pancake	batter	combine	rice	flour,	coconut	milk,	water	and
turmeric	in	a	mixing	bowl,	whisk	well	to	mix	then	allow	batter	to	rest	for
quarter-hour.
Step		2	Place	pork	and	prawns	in	a	huge	mixing	bowl,	add	marinade	ingredients,
mix	well	to	mix.	Cover	with	cling	wrap	and	place	in	the	fridge	to	marinate	for

The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese dish featuring diced beef, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Ingredients**: 
   - Various sauces (oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce)
   - Garlic, caster sugar, sesame oil
   - Beef fillet (1600g), red onions, watercress
   - Lime juice and fresh red chili for a dipping sauce

2. **Preparation Steps**:
   - Marinating the beef with sauces and seasonings for 4 hours.
   - Preparing a lime dipping sauce by mixing lime juice, sugar, and chili.

   - Marinating, mixing, and stir-frying.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Vietnamese Eggplant with Spicy Sauce." It includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Eggplant with Spicy Sauce
2. **Servings**: 4
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Vegetable oil
   - White eggplant
   - Lemongrass
   - Green onions
   - Fresh basil
   - Red chile pepper
   - Garlic
   - Fresh ginger
   - Oyster sauce
   - White sugar
4. **Cooking Directions**:
   - Step 1: Sauté eggplant in oil until golden brown and soft.
   - Step 2: Combine remaining ingredients, pour over eggplant, and cook until the green onion wilts. Stir in oyster sauce and sugar, then cook until flavors combine.

Overall, the section details the ingredients and steps required to prepare a Vietnamese dish featuring eggplant and a spicy sauce.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Eggplant	with	Spicy	Sauce
Servings:	4
	
	
Ingredients
	
6	tablespoons	vegetable	oil,	divided
2	white	eggplant,	sliced
6	tablespoons	minced	lemongrass
2	tablespoons	chopped	green	onions
2	tablespoons	chopped	fresh	basil
2	teaspoons	minced	red	chile	pepper
2	tablespoons	crushed	garlic
2	teaspoons	minced	fresh	ginger
2	tablespoons	oyster	sauces
2	teaspoons	white	sugar
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Heat	1	tablespoon	oil	in	a	skillet	over	medium	heat.	Add	eggplant;	cook
until	golden	brown	and	soft,	however,	not	mushy,	three	to	five	minutes	per	side.
Step	2	Mix	remaining	2	tablespoons	oil,	lemongrass,	garlic,	green	onion,	basil,
red	chile,	and	ginger	together	in	a	bowl.	Pour	over	eggplant	in	the	skillet.	Cook
until	green	onion	wilts,	about	three	minutes.	Stir	in	oyster	sauce	and	sugar.	Cook
until	flavors	combine,	2-3	three	minutes.	Remove	from	heat.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese dish called "fish with dill and vermicelli." It includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Dish Name**: Vietnamese fish with dill and vermicelli
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Fresh dill sprigs
   - Green shallots
   - Garlic cloves
   - Ground turmeric
   - Caster sugar
   - Fresh ginger
   - Fish sauce
   - Skinless firm white fish fillets
   - Vermicelli noodles
   - Vegetable oil
   - Lime juice
   - Roasted peanuts
   - Fresh red chili (for serving)
   - Lime wedges (for serving)

4. **Directions**:
   - Step 1: Marinate the fish with a mixture of dill, shallots, garlic, ginger, turmeric, sugar, and fish sauce.
   - Step 2: Prepare the vermicelli noodles by soaking them in boiling water, then refreshing them under cold water and tossing with oil. Mix lime juice, extra sugar, and remaining fish sauce for dressing.

5. **Preparation Techniques**: Marinating, soaking, draining, and tossing ingredients.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and steps necessary to prepare the dish, emphasizing the use of fresh herbs and flavors typical in Vietnamese cuisine.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	fish	with	dill	and	vermicelli
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2/3	cup	fresh	dill	sprigs
12	green	shallots
6	garlic	cloves,	chopped
1	tablespoon	ground	turmeric
2	teaspoons	caster	sugar
6	pieces	cm		fresh	ginger,	peeled,	finely	grated
120	1/2	60ml	(1/4	cup)	fish	sauces
8	4	(about	720g)	skinless	firm	white	fish	fillets
240	g	vermicelli	noodles
2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
1/4	cup	lime	juice
2	tablespoons	caster	sugar,	extra
1/4	cup	roasted	peanuts,	chopped
thinly	sliced	long	fresh	red	chilli,	to	serve
lime	wedges,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Place	1	tbs	of	the	dill	sprigs,	1	thinly	sliced	shallot,	garlic,	ginger,
turmeric,	and	sugar	in	a	mortar.	Pound	until	paste	forms.	Stir	in	2	tbs	of	the	fish
sauce.	Place	fish	in	a	glass	bowl.	Pour	over	the	dill	mixture.	Turn	to	coat.	Cover.
Reserve	for	ten	minutes	to	marinate.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	place	noodles	in	a	sizable	bowl.	Cover	with	boiling	water.
Use	a	fork	to	split	up	noodles.	Drain.	Refresh	under	cold	running	water.	Transfer
to	a	bowl.	Drizzle	with	1	tbsp	of	the	oil.	Toss	to	coat.	Stir	lime	juice,	extra	sugar,
and	remaining	fish	sauce	in	a	bowl	until	sugar	dissolves.	Slice	remaining	shallots
into	5cm	pieces.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese glazed Christmas ham, serving approximately 10 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Ingredients and quantities needed for the recipe.
- Step-by-step directions for preparing and cooking the ham.
- Cooking techniques such as scoring, basting, and reducing a sauce.

**Key Entities:**
- **Ingredients:** minced ginger, minced garlic, lime (zest and juice), fish sauce, red chili, dark soy sauce, sugar, star anise, cinnamon sticks, half leg ham, cloves.
- **Cooking Instructions:** Preheating the oven, mixing ingredients in a saucepan, removing skin from the ham, scoring the ham, piercing with cloves, and basting with syrup.
- **Cooking Temperature:** 200°C conventional (180°C fan-forced).
- **Cooking Time:** Approximately thirty minutes. 

Overall, the section details the preparation of a festive dish that combines traditional Vietnamese flavors with a holiday classic.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	glazed	Christmas	ham
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	teaspoons	minced	ginger
1	1/2	tablespoons	minced	garlic
zest	and	juice	of	1	lime
1	cup	fish	sauces
2	long	red	chilli,	finely	diced
2	tablespoons	dark	soy	sauce
6	tablespoons	sugar
8	star	anise
2	cinnamon	sticks
8	4-5kg	half	leg	ham	on	the	bone
1/2	cup	cloves
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Preheat	oven	to	200C	conventional	(180C	fan-forced).
Step		2	Place	ginger,	garlic,	chili,	lime	zest,	fish	sauce,	dark	soy,	sugar,	star
anise,	cinnamon,	and	1/2	cup	water	in	a	little	saucepan,	stir	to	mix	then	place
over	medium	heat.	Cook	until	it	reduces	and	becomes	slightly	syrupy.	Add	lime
juice	and	stir.
Step		3	Remove	skin	from	ham	with	a	huge	knife,	trim	any	extra	fat	from	skin.
Step		4	Score	ham	in	a	criss	cross	pattern.
Step		5	Pierce	individual	cloves	around	ham	to	create	a	pretty	pattern.
Step		6	Once	syrup	has	reduced,	place	ham	on	baking	tray	lined	with	foil	and
baste	ham	with	adequate	syrup.
Step		7	Place	ham	in	oven	and	cook	for	approximately	thirty	minutes,	basting
