metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Golden Chicken Wings, serving 6 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Golden Chicken Wings
2. **Servings**: 6
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Chicken wings (18 pieces, tips removed and cut in half)
   - Garlic (3 tablespoons, coarsely chopped)
   - Soy sauce (6 tablespoons)
   - Asian fish sauce (6 tablespoons)
   - Onion (3/4, cut into chunks)
   - Fresh lemon juice (3 tablespoons)
   - Sesame oil (3 tablespoons)
   - Salt (1 1/2 teaspoons)
   - Freshly ground black pepper (1 1/2 teaspoons)
   - Garlic powder (1 1/2 tablespoons)
   - White sugar (1 1/2 tablespoons)

4. **Directions**:
   - **Step 1**: Marinate chicken wings with garlic, onion, soy sauce, fish sauce, lemon juice, sesame oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and sugar for 2 hours to overnight.
   - **Step 2**: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) and prepare a baking dish with aluminum foil.
   - **Step 3**: Bake the marinated wings, turning once and brushing with reserved marinade, until golden brown and cooked through (approximately 30 minutes).

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and step-by-step instructions for preparing a flavorful Vietnamese chicken wing dish.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Golden	Chicken	Wings
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
18	eaches	chicken	wings,	tips	removed	and	wings	cut	in
half	at	joint
3	tablespoons	cloves	garlic,	peeled	and	coarsely
chopped
6	tablespoons	soy	sauce
6	tablespoons	asian	fish	sauces
3/4	onion,	cut	into	chunks
3	tablespoons	fresh	lemon	juice
3	tablespoons	sesame	oil
1	1/2	teaspoons	salt
1	1/2	teaspoons	freshly	ground	black	pepper
1	1/2	tablespoons	garlic	powder
1	1/2	tablespoons	white	sugar
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Place	the	chicken	wings,	garlic,	and	onion	into	a	huge	bowl.	Pour	in	soy
sauce,	fish	sauce,	lemon	juice,	and	sesame	oil.	Season	with	salt,	pepper,	garlic
powder,	and	sugar;	toss	together	until	well	coated.	Cover	and	refrigerate	2	hours
to	overnight.
Step	2	Preheat	oven	to	400	degrees	F	(200	degrees	C).	Line	a	9x13	inch	baking
dish	with	aluminum	foil.
Step	3	Remove	wings	from	marinade,	reserving	extra.	Arrange	wings	within	a
layer	over	bottom	of	prepared	dish.	Bake	in	preheated	oven,	turning	once	and
brushing	with	reserved	marinade,	until	deep,	golden	brown	and	meat	juices	run
clear,	approximately	thirty	minutes.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Grilled Lemongrass Chicken, serving six people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese Grilled Lemongrass Chicken
- Servings: 6
- Ingredients: A list of ingredients including canola oil, lemongrass, soy sauce, brown sugar, lemon juice, garlic, fish sauce, and chicken thighs.
- Directions: Step-by-step instructions for preparing and grilling the chicken.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: Canola oil, lemongrass, soy sauce, light brown sugar, lemon juice, garlic, fish sauce, chicken thighs.
- Cooking Method: Grilling.
- Cooking Time: Marination for 20 minutes to 1 hour, grilling for 3 to 5 minutes per side.
- Temperature: Internal temperature of chicken should reach at least 165°F (74°C). 

Overall, the section focuses on the preparation and cooking of a specific Vietnamese dish, highlighting the ingredients and cooking process involved.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Grilled	Lemongrass	Chicken
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3	tablespoons	canola	oil
3	tablespoons	finely	chopped	lemongrass
1	tablespoon	soy	sauce
1	tablespoon	light	brown	sugar
1	1/2	tablespoons	lemon	juice
1	tablespoon	minced	garlic
1	1/2	teaspoons	fish	sauces
2	1/4	pounds	chicken	thighs,	or	more	to	taste,	pounded
to	an	even	thickness
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Mix	canola	oil,	lemongrass,	lemon	juice,	soy	sauce,	brown	sugar,	garlic,
and	fish	sauce	together	in	a	mixing	bowl	before	sugar	is	dissolved;	add	chicken
and	turn	to	coat	in	the	marinade.
Step	2	Marinate	chicken	in	the	refrigerator	for	20	minutes	to	at	least	one	1	hour.
Step	3	Preheat	grill	for	medium	heat	and	lightly	oil	the	grate.
Step	4	Remove	chicken	thighs	from	the	marinade	and	shake	to	eliminate	excess
marinade.	Discard	the	rest	of	the	marinade.
Step	5	Grill	chicken	until	no	pinker	in	the	guts	and	the	juices	run	clear,	three	to
five	minutes	per	side.	An	instant-read	thermometer	inserted	into	the	center
should	read	at	least	165	degrees	F	(74	degrees	C).

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Nuoc Cham," a Vietnamese dipping sauce, serving 6 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Nuoc Cham (Vietnamese Dipping Sauce)
- Ingredients: 
  - White sugar
  - Warm water
  - Distilled white vinegar
  - Lemon juice
  - Fish sauce
  - Minced garlic
  - Thai chili peppers
  - Green onions

**Entities:**
- Servings: 6
- Measurements: Tablespoons, cups, and fractions for ingredient quantities
- Preparation Steps: Mixing ingredients in a bowl until sugar dissolves and combining all components.

The section includes both the ingredients list and the initial step of the preparation process.

__data__.text:
Nuoc	Cham	(Vietnamese	Dipping	Sauce)
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
5	tablespoons	white	sugar
2/3	cup	warm	water
6	1/2	tablespoons	distilled	white	vinegar
3/5	lemon,	juiced
5	tablespoons	fish	sauces
3	1/2	tablespoons	garlic,	minced
3	3/5	peppers	thai	chile	peppers,	chopped
1	1/5	green	onions,	thinly	sliced
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Stir	the	sugar	and	hot	water	together	in	a	bowl	before	sugar	dissolves
completely;	add	the	fish	sauce,	vinegar,	lemon	juice,	garlic,	Thai	hot	peppers,
and	green	onion	to	the	mixture.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Vietnamese Lemon Grass Chicken Curry," serving six people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese Lemon Grass Chicken Curry
- Servings: 6
- Ingredients: Lists various ingredients including vegetable oil, lemon grass, chicken, fish sauce, curry powder, water, cornstarch, and cilantro.
- Directions: Step-by-step instructions for cooking the dish, including heating oil, cooking chicken, adding liquids and spices, and thickening the sauce.

**Entities:**
- Cuisine: Vietnamese
- Main Ingredients: Lemon grass, chicken, fish sauce, curry powder, cilantro
- Cooking Techniques: Sautéing, simmering, thickening sauce

Overall, the section outlines a specific dish, its ingredients, and preparation method.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Lemon	Grass	Chicken	Curry
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
1	1/2	lemons	grass,	minced
1	1/2	(3	pound)	whole	chicken,	cut	into
pieces
1	1/2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
2	tablespoons	curry	powder
1	cup	water
1	1/2	tablespoons	cornstarch
1	1/2	tablespoons	chopped	cilantro
\
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Heat	the	vegetable	oil	in	a	skillet	over	medium	heat.	Stir	in	the	lemon
grass,	cooking	until	fragrant,	three	to	five	minutes.	Place	the	chicken	into	the
skillet.	Cook	and	stir	the	chicken	until	no	pinker	in	the	guts	and	your	skin	is
browned	about	ten	minutes.	Stir	in	the	water,	fish	sauce,	and	curry	powder.
Increase	heat	to	high	and	bring	to	a	boil.	Reduce	heat	and	simmer	for	10	to	a
quarter-hour.
Step	2	Mix	cornstarch	and	2	tablespoons	of	the	curry	sauce	in	a	little	bowl,	until
smooth.	Stir	the	cornstarch	mixture	into	the	skillet	and	simmer	until	sauce	has
thickened,	about	five	minutes.	Garnish	with	cilantro	before	serving.

metadata.section_summary:
**Summary:**

**Main Topic:**
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese lemongrass and chilli steamed fish, detailing the ingredients and cooking instructions.

**Entities:**
- **Dish Name:** Vietnamese lemongrass and chilli steamed fish
- **Servings:** 10
- **Ingredients:**
  - Lemongrass (4 stalks, white part only)
  - Long red chilli (2, thinly sliced)
  - Green onions (4, thinly sliced)
  - Fresh ginger (8 pieces, finely grated)
  - Kecap manis (1/4 cup)
  - Garlic cloves (4, finely chopped)
  - Whole snapper (4 x 650g, cleaned)
  - Fresh mint sprigs (1/2 cup)
  - Steamed jasmine rice (to serve)
  - Salad (to serve)
  - Lime wedges (to serve)

**Cooking Directions:**
1. Preheat the oven and prepare baking dishes.
2. Mix lemongrass, chilli, onion, garlic, ginger, and kecap manis.
3. Prepare the fish by rinsing, drying, and making cuts to insert the mixture.
4. Bake the fish covered with foil until cooked through.
5. Serve topped with mint, along with rice, salad, and lime wedges.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	lemongrass	and	chilli	steamed	fish
													
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
4	stalks	lemongrass	(white	part	only),	finely	chopped
2	long	red	chilli,	thinly	sliced
4	green	onions,	thinly	sliced
8	pieces	cm		fresh	ginger,	peeled,	finely	grated
1/4	cup	kecap	manis
4	garlic	cloves,	finely	chopped
4	x	650g	whole	snapper,	cleaned
1/2	cup	fresh	mint	sprigs
steamed	jasmine	rice,	to	serve
salad	(see	note),	to	serve
lime	wedges,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Preheat	oven	to	200C/180C	fan-forced.	Line	2	large	baking	dishes	with
baking	paper.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	place	the	lemongrass,	chili,	onion,	garlic,	ginger,	and	kecap
manis	in	a	little	bowl.	Stir	to	mix.
Step		3	Rinse	1	fish	under	cool	water.	Pat	dry	with	paper	towel.	Make	3	shallow
cuts	into	the	thickest	part	of	both	sides	of	the	fish.	Spread	1/2	the	lemongrass
mixture	into	the	cuts	and	inside	cavity	of	the	fish.
Step		4	Place	fish	in	a	prepared	dish.	Cover	dish	tightly	with	foil.	Repeat	process
with	second	fish	and	remaining	lemongrass	mixture.	Place	in	second	prepared
baking	dish.	Cover	dish	tightly	with	foil.	Bake	both	catch	25	minutes	or	until	just
cooked	through.	Spoon	any	cooking	juices	over	fish.
Step	5	Top	fish	with	mint.	Serve	with	rice,	salad,	dressing	and	lime	wedges.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese lemongrass beef and noodle salad, serving 10 people. Key ingredients include dried vermicelli noodles, lemongrass, garlic, lean beef mince, soy sauce, red chili, fish sauce, lime juice, caster sugar, iceberg lettuce, carrots, fresh mint, Thai basil, salted roasted peanuts, and optional fried shallots. 

The preparation involves soaking the noodles, stir-frying lemongrass, garlic, and chili, adding the beef mince, and then combining it with a sauce made of soy sauce, fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. The dish is finished by mixing in the vegetables and herbs. 

Main topics and entities:
- Recipe title: Vietnamese lemongrass beef and noodle salad
- Servings: 10
- Key ingredients: vermicelli noodles, lemongrass, beef mince, soy sauce, fish sauce, lime juice, vegetables, herbs, peanuts
- Cooking methods: soaking, stir-frying, mixing

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	lemongrass	beef	and	noodle	salad
													
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
300	g	dried	vermicelli	noodles
2	tablespoons	vegetable	oil
2	stalks	lemongrass	(white	part	only),	finely	chopped
4	garlic	cloves,	crushed
1200	g	lean	beef	mince
1/4	cup	soy	sauce
2	small	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
2	tablespoons	lime	juice
1	1/2	tablespoons	caster	sugar
6	cups	iceberg	lettuce,	thickly	shredded
2	carrots,	cut	into	matchsticks	(see	notes)
1	cup	fresh	mint	leaves,	torn
2/3	cup	fresh	thai	basil	leaves
2/3	cup	peanuts,	salted,	roasted
1/4	cup	fried	shallots	(optional,	see	note)
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Place	noodles	in	a	sizable	heatproof	bowl.	Cover	with	boiling	water.
Reserve	for	five	minutes	or	until	soft.	Drain.	Roughly	chop.
Step		2	Heat	a	wok	over	high	temperature.	Add	oil.	Swirl	to	coat.	Add
lemongrass,	garlic	and	chilli.	Stirfry	for	1	minute	or	until	fragrant.	Add	mince.
Stir-fry,	splitting	up	mince,	for	five	minutes	or	until	browned.	Combine	soy,	fish
sauce,	lime	juice	and	sugar	in	a	little	jug.	Increase	wok.	Stir-fry	for	2	minutes	or
until	heated	through.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese meatball lettuce wraps, serving 10 people. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Recipe Title:** Vietnamese Meatball Lettuce Wraps
2. **Servings:** 10
3. **Ingredients:** 
   - Pork sausages
   - Sunflower oil
   - Fish sauce
   - Honey
   - Carrots
   - Soy sauce
   - Lebanese cucumbers
   - Red onions
   - Baby cos lettuce
   - Roasted peanuts
   - Red chili
   - Vietnamese dipping sauce (nuoc cham)

4. **Directions:** 
   - Step 1: Prepare and cook the meatballs, adding sauces and honey.
   - Step 2: Assemble the wraps with vegetables, meatballs, peanuts, chili, and dipping sauce.

**Entities:**
- **Ingredients:** Specific food items and their quantities.
- **Cooking Techniques:** Deep frying and assembling wraps.
- **Cultural Reference:** Vietnamese cuisine, specifically the use of nuoc cham as a dipping sauce.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	meatball	lettuce	wraps
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1200	g	pork	sausages
1/4	cup	sunflower	oil
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces
2	tablespoons	honey
2	large	carrots,	grated	lengthways
2	tablespoons	soy	sauce
2	lebanese	cucumbers,	grated	lengthways
2	red	onions,	grated	lengthways
4	baby	cos	lettuces,	leaves	separated
1	cup	(75g)	roasted	peanuts,	chopped
2	long	red	chilli,	thinly	sliced
1	cup	(125ml)	vietnamese	dipping	sauces	(nuoc	cham)
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Squeeze	the	sausage	meat	from	its	casings	and	roll	into	walnut-sized
balls.	Heat	oil	in	a	deep	frypan	over	medium	heat	and	cook	the	meatballs,
turning,	for	5-6	minutes	until	golden	and	cooked	through.	Add	fish	sauce,	soy
sauce,	honey,	and	1	tbs	water	to	the	pan	and	stir	to	coat,	scraping	underneath	of
the	pan,	then	reserve.
Step		2	Divide	carrot,	cucumber,	and	onion	among	lettuce	leaves,	then	top	with
meatballs,	peanuts,	and	chili.	Drizzle	over	dipping	sauce	and	pan	juices	to	serve.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Pho, a traditional Vietnamese noodle soup. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Recipe Title:** Pho
2. **Servings:** 6
3. **Ingredients:** 
   - Beef shank (bone-in)
   - Onions
   - Fresh ginger root
   - Salt
   - Fish sauce
   - Star anise
   - Dried rice noodles
   - Cooked beef sirloin
   - Green onions
   - Fresh bean sprouts
   - Cilantro

4. **Directions:** 
   - Cooking process involving boiling beef shank, preparing broth, broiling onions, cooking noodles, and assembling the dish.

**Entities:**
- **Cooking Methods:** Boiling, simmering, broiling, draining.
- **Preparation Steps:** Skimming foam, peeling, stirring ingredients, dividing servings.
- **Final Assembly:** Combining noodles, beef, and toppings in serving bowls and adding broth.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and step-by-step instructions for making Pho.

__data__.text:
Pho
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
8	pounds	bone-in	beef	shank
2	onions
10	slices	fresh	ginger	root
2	teaspoons	salt
5	tablespoons	fish	sauces
2	pod	star	anise,	whole
2	(8-ounce)	packages	dried	rice	noodles
1	pound	cooked	beef	sirloin,	thinly	sliced
6	medium	(4-1/8"	long)s	green	onions,	chopped
3	cups	fresh	bean	sprouts
12	sprigs	cilantro
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	In	a	huge	pot	over	medium	heat,	bring	beef	shank	and	3	quarts	water	to	a
boil.	Skim	off	foam.	Reduce	heat,	cover	and	simmer	4	hours.
Step	2	Preheat	oven	broiler.	Place	unpeeled	whole	onion	under	broiler	until	soft.
Remove	and	peel.
Step	3	Stir	onion,	ginger,	anise,	salt	and	fish	sauce	into	beef	mixture.
Step	4	Bring	a	huge	pot	of	lightly	salted	water	to	a	boil.	Add	rice	noodles	and
cook	for	8	to	ten	minutes	or	until	al	dente;	drain.
Step	5	Divide	noodles	into	three	serving	bowls.	Place	cooked	sirloin	along	with
pasta	in	bowls.	Sprinkle	green	onions,	bean	sprouts	and	cilantro	evenly	in	bowls.
Strain	beef	broth	and	divide	evenly	between	serving	bowls,	pouring	over
assembled	ingredients.	Serve	simultaneously.

Overall, the section outlines the necessary ingredients and step-by-step instructions for preparing the dessert.

__data__.text:
Banh	gan	(coconut	creme	caramel	with	lemon
grass)
																											
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	x	400ml	can	coconut	milk
4	stems	lemons	grass,	coarsely	chopped
120	1/2	60ml	(1/4	cup)	cointreau	liqueur
761	375ml	(1	1/2	cups)	pouring	cream
641	315g	(1	1/2	cups)	caster	sugar
160	2/3	80ml	(1/3	cup)	water
6	eggs
6	eggs	yolks
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Combine	the	coconut	milk,	cream,	lemongrass,	and	Cointreau	in	a
medium	saucepan	over	medium-low	heat.	Cook,	stirring	occasionally	before
mixture	almost	involves	the	boil.	Reserve	for	20	minutes	to	build	up	the
flavours.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	combine	215g	(1	cup)	of	sugar	and	the	water	in	a	saucepan
over	low	heat.	Cook,	stirring,	for	2	minutes	or	before	sugar	dissolves.	Increase
heat	to	high.	Bring	to	the	boil.	Boil,	without	stirring,	occasionally	brushing	down
the	medial	side	of	the	pan	with	a	pastry	brush	dipped	in	water,	for	five	minutes
or	until	golden.	Pour	into	an	8cm-deep,	11	x	21cm	(base	measurement)	loaf	pan.
Tilt	the	pan	to	evenly	coat	the	bottom	and	just	a	little	way	up	the	sides.
Step		3	Preheat	oven	to	160°C.	Whisk	the	eggs,	egg	yolks	and	remaining	sugar

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Banh Mi" (Vietnamese chicken rolls) and includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Recipe Title**: Banh Mi (Vietnamese Chicken Rolls)
2. **Servings**: 10
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Cucumbers (Lebanese)
   - Rice vinegar
   - Sugar (caster)
   - Soy sauce (light)
   - Peanut oil
   - Carrots
   - Honey (Capilano Dark & Bold)
   - Garlic (finely chopped)
   - Chicken thighs (trimmed)
   - Baguette (cut into rolls)
   - Mayonnaise (reduced-fat whole-egg)
   - Lettuce (soft butter lettuce)
   - Pickled jalapeno peppers (optional)
   - Hot chili sauce
   - Fresh coriander (sprig)

4. **Directions**:
   - Step 1: Prepare cucumbers by shaving into ribbons and salting them.
   - Step 2: Heat rice vinegar and sugar until dissolved, then cool.
   - Step 3: Prepare carrots and combine with cucumbers and vinegar mixture, then chill.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and initial preparation steps for making Vietnamese chicken rolls.

__data__.text:
Banh	mi	(vietnamese	chicken	rolls)
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	cucumbers	Lebanese	cucumber
2	cups	rice	vinegar	(250ml)	rice	vinegar
1	cup	sugar	(110g)	caster	sugar
1/4	cup	soy	sauce	light	soy	sauce
2	tablespoons	peanut	oil	peanut	oil
2	carrots	carrot
2	tablespoons	honey	Capilano	Dark	&	Bold	Honey
1/4	cup	garlic	garlic	finely	chopped
1000	chicken	thighs	chicken	thigh	fillets	trimmed
2	baguette	cut	into	4	or	4	soft	long	rolls
2	tablespoons	mayonnaise	reduced-fat	whole-egg
mayonnaise
1	1/4	cups	lettuce	soft	butter	lettuce	torn
2	tablespoons	pickled	jalapeno	peppers	(optional)
2	tablespoons	sauces	hot	chilli	sauce	(see	notes)
sprig	coriander	Few	of	fresh	coriander
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Use	a	peeler	to	shave	the	cucumber	into	ribbons,	then	toss	in	a	bowl	with
1	teaspoon	salt	and	are	a	symbol	of	1	hour.
Step		2	Heat	the	rice	vinegar	and	sugar	in	a	little	pan	over	medium	heat,	stirring
before	the	sugar	has	dissolved,	then	cool.
Step		3	Shave	carrot	lengthways	into	ribbons	with	a	vegetable	peeler,	then	cut
into	fine	matchsticks.	Add	carrot,	cucumber,	and	their	juices	to	the	vinegar
mixture	and	chill	for	at	least	2	hours	or	overnight.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Pho Ga (Chicken Pho) and includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Pho Ga (Chicken Pho)
2. **Servings**: 6
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Dried rice noodles (3/4 package, 16-ounce)
   - Whole chicken (3/4)
   - Whole star anise (1 1/2 each)
   - Monosodium glutamate (MSG) (3/8 teaspoon)
   - Peeled ginger (2-inch piece)
   - Salt (1 1/2 teaspoons)
   - Water (3 cups, to cover)
4. **Directions**:
   - Soak noodles in cool water for about 30 minutes.
   - Cook chicken with ginger, star anise, MSG, salt, and water over medium heat for about 40 minutes until cooked through.
   - Cool and shred the chicken after cooking.
   - Boil water and cook the noodles until tender (1-2 minutes), then drain.
   - Serve noodles topped with shredded chicken and ladle in broth.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and step-by-step instructions for preparing Chicken Pho, a traditional Vietnamese dish.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Pho	Ga	(Chicken)
	
Servings
:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3/4	(16-ounce)	package	1/4-inch	thick	dried	rice
noodles
3/4	whole	chicken
1	1/2	eaches	whole	star	anise
3/8	teaspoon	monosodium	glutamate	(msg)
3/4	(2	inch)	piece	peeled	ginger
1	1/2	teaspoons	salt
3	cups	water	to	cover
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Cover	noodles	with	cool	water;	reserve	to	soak,	about	thirty	minutes.
Step	2	Place	chicken,	ginger,	star	anise,	and	monosodium	glutamate	in	a	huge
pot.	Sprinkle	with	salt	and	cover	with	water.	Cook	over	medium	heat	until	juices
run	clear,	about	40	minutes.	An	instant-read	thermometer	inserted	into	the
thickest	section	of	the	thigh,	close	to	the	bone	should	read	165	degrees	F	(74
degrees	C).
Step	3	Remove	chicken	from	pot	and	cool	until	easily	handled,	15	to	20	minutes.
Remove	skin	and	shred	chicken	meat.
Step	4	Drain	noodles.	Bring	a	huge	pot	of	water	to	a	boil.	Cook	noodles	in
boiling	water,	stirring	occasionally,	until	noodles	are	tender	yet	firm	to	the	bite,
one	to	two	2	minutes.	Drain	and	divide	among	serving	bowls.
Step	5	Top	noodles	with	shredded	chicken	and	ladle	in	broth.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Pickled Daikon Radish and Carrots, serving 12 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese Pickled Daikon Radish and Carrots
- Servings: 12
- Ingredients: 
  - Warm water
  - Rice vinegar
  - Salt
  - Carrots (julienned)
  - Sugar
  - Daikon radishes (julienned)
- Directions: 
  - Combine ingredients to create a pickling solution.
  - Pack vegetables in a jar and cover with the solution, then refrigerate.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: warm water, rice vinegar, salt, carrots, sugar, daikon radishes
- Cooking method: pickling
- Storage: refrigerate for at least one day, ideally three days.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Pickled	Daikon	Radish	and	Carrots
Servings:	12
	
	
Ingredients
	
4	3/4	cups	warm	water
1	cup	rice	vinegar
2	1/2	tablespoons	salt
2/3	pound	carrots,	julienned
3	1/2	tablespoons	sugar
2/3	pound	daikon	radishes,	julienned
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Combine	water,	vinegar,	sugar,	and	salt	in	a	bowl.	Stir	until	salt	and	sugar
have	dissolved.
Step	2	Place	carrots	and	daikon	in	a	sterile	jar.	Pour	vinegar	mixture	at	the	top
until	vegetables	are	completely	covered.	Seal	jar	and	refrigerate	for	at	least	one
day,	ideally	3	days.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Vietnamese Pork and Pineapple Noodles," serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Ingredients**: 
   - Leftover roast pork (600g)
   - Dried vermicelli noodles (400g)
   - Pineapple (1000g)
   - Fresh coriander leaves (2 cups)
   - Fresh mint leaves (2 cups)
   - Lebanese cucumbers (2 medium)
   - Green onions (8)
   - Red onions (2 small)
   - Lemon juice (5 tablespoons)
   - Fish sauce (4 tablespoons)
   - Brown sugar (2 tablespoons)

2. **Cooking Directions**:
   - Step 1: Prepare the pork by removing the crackling, cutting the meat, and roasting the crackling until crisp.
   - Step 2: Soak the vermicelli noodles in boiling water until tender, then drain and rinse.
   - Step 3: Combine the noodles with pork, pineapple, cucumbers, herbs, and onions. Prepare a dressing with lemon juice, fish sauce, and sugar, then toss everything together and serve topped with crackling.

3. **Cooking Techniques**: Roasting, soaking, draining, and tossing ingredients.

Overall, the recipe emphasizes the use of fresh herbs and a combination of flavors from the pork, pineapple, and dressing to create a vibrant dish.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	pork	and	pineapple	noodles
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
600	g	leftover	roast	pork	(with	crackling)	(see	related
recipe)
400	g	dried	vermicelli	noodles
1000	g	pineapple,	peeled,	cored,	cut	into	batons
2	cups	fresh	coriander	leaves
2	cups	fresh	mint	leaves
2	medium	lebanese	cucumbers,	cut	into	batons
8	green	onions,	thinly	sliced	diagonally
2	small	red	onions,	thinly	sliced
5	tablespoons	lemon	juice
4	tablespoons	fish	sauces
2	tablespoons	brown	sugar
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Remove	crackling	from	pork.	Cut	meat	into	batons.	Preheat	oven	to
250C/230C	fan-forced.	Line	a	baking	tray	with	foil.	Place	crackling	on	the	tray.
Roast	for	ten	minutes	or	until	reheated	and	crisp.	Put	on	a	plate	lined	with	paper
towel.	Using	kitchen	scissors,	roughly	cut	crackling	into	pieces.
Step		2	Meanwhile,	place	noodles	in	a	heatproof	bowl.	Cover	with	boiling	water.
Are	a	symbol	of	five	minutes	or	until	tender.	Drain.	Rinse.	Drain.	Transfer	to	a
huge	bowl.
Step	3	Add	pork,	pineapple,	cucumber,	coriander,	mint,	green	onion	and	red
onion	to	noodles.	Place	lemon	juice,	fish	sauce	and	sugar	in	a	little	bowl.	Stir
until	sugar	has	dissolved.	Drizzle	lemon	juice	mixture	over	noodle	mixture.	Toss
to	coat.	Sprinkle	with	crackling.	Serve.

metadata.section_summary:
**Summary:**

This section provides a recipe for Vietnamese prawn and sweet potato clusters, serving 10 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese prawn and sweet potato clusters
- Servings: 10
- Ingredients: 
  - 1/2 cup plain flour
  - 1/2 cup potato starch
  - 2 eggs
  - 1 teaspoon baking powder
  - 2/3 cup water
  - 300 g green prawns (peeled, deveined, coarsely chopped)
  - 300 g sweet potatoes (peeled, thinly julienned)
  - 4 green shallots
  - Light olive oil (for frying)
  - Vietnamese dipping sauce (for serving)
  - Lime wedges (for serving)

**Directions:**
1. Prepare the batter by whisking the flours and baking powder, adding eggs and water, then incorporating prawns, sweet potatoes, and shallots.
2. Heat oil in a saucepan and fry the batter in batches until golden brown. Serve with dipping sauce and lime wedges.

**Entities:**
- Cuisine: Vietnamese
- Main Ingredients: Prawns, sweet potatoes, flour, eggs
- Cooking Method: Frying
- Accompaniments: Dipping sauce, lime wedges

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	prawn	and	sweet	potato	clusters
													
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1/2	cup	plain	flour
1/2	cup	potatoes	starch
2	eggs
1	teaspoon	baking	powder
2/3	cup	water
300	g	green	prawns,	peeled,	deveined	and	coarsely
chopped
300	g	sweet	potatoes,	peeled,	thinly	julienne
4	green	shallots
light	olive	oil,	to	fry
vietnamese	dipping	sauce,	to	serve
lime	wedges,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step		1	Whisk	flours	with	baking	powder.	Make	a	well	at	the	heart	and	add	egg.
Gradually	add	water,	whisking	to	create	a	smooth	batter.	Add	prawn,	sweet
potato	and	green	shallots.
Step		2	Pour	light	essential	olive	oil	to	one-third	of	just	how	up	the	medial	side
of	a	medium	saucepan.	Heat	to	170°C	over	high	temperature.	Cook	1	⁄4	cupfuls
of	batter	in	oil,	in	2	batches,	for	2	minutes	each	side.	Serve	with	Vietnamese
dipping	sauce	and	lime	wedges

metadata.section_summary:
The section outlines a cooking process for a Vietnamese dish that involves several key steps and ingredients. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Preparation of Shrimp**: The shrimp is briefly cooked in a pan and then ground into a powder using a pestle and mortar.
2. **Mixing Ingredients**: Pork is combined with caster sugar, fish sauce, lemongrass, and pepper. Fresh herbs are prepared separately.
3. **Stir-Frying**: The cooking process involves heating oil in a wok, stir-frying eschalots, mushrooms, and fungus, then adding the pork mixture and cooking until browned. Brown sugar, chicken stock, fish sauce, and vinegar are added to create a flavorful base.
4. **Cooking Noodles**: Noodles are soaked in boiling water, drained, and then tossed in the wok with the other ingredients to combine and heat through.
5. **Serving**: The dish is served by dividing the noodles into bowls, topping them with ground shrimp and a mixture of herbs.

**Entities:**
- **Ingredients**: Shrimp, pork, caster sugar, fish sauce, lemongrass, pepper, eschalots, mushrooms, fungus, brown sugar, chicken stock, vinegar, noodles, herbs.
- **Cooking Techniques**: Stir-frying, grinding, soaking, and combining ingredients.
- **Equipment**: Pan, pestle and mortar, wok, bowls. 

Overall, the section provides a detailed recipe for preparing a flavorful Vietnamese noodle dish.

__data__.text:
Step		2	Meanwhile,	place	shrimp	in	a	little	pan	and	stir	over	medium	heat	for	1
minute	or	until	fragrant.	Cool.	Utilizing	a	pestle	and	mortar,	grind	to	a	powder.
Step		3	Combine	pork,	caster	sugar,	1	tablespoon	fish	sauce	and	lemongrass.
Season	with	pepper.	Combine	herbs	in	a	clean	bowl.
Step		4	Heat	oil	in	a	wok	over	medium	heat	and	stir-fry	eschalots	for	1	minute	or
until	soft.	Add	mushrooms	and	fungus,	and	stir-fry	for	five	minutes.	Add	pork
mixture	and	stir-fry,	splitting	up	the	mince	with	a	wooden	spoon,	for	five
minutes	or	until	lightly	browned.	Add	brown	sugar	and	stir-fry	for	an	additional
minute	or	until	sugar	is	caramelised.	Add	chicken	stock,	remaining	2
tablespoons	fish	sauce	and	vinegar,	and	bring	to	a	simmer.
Step		5	Meanwhile,	place	noodles	in	a	bowl.	Cover	with	boiling	water,	stir	gently
to	loosen,	then	drain.	Increase	wok	and	cook,	tossing	gently,	for	three	minutes	or
until	combined	and	heated	through.
Step		6	Divide	noodles	among	bowls,	scatter	with	ground	shrimp,	then	top	with	a
small	number	of	the	herb	mixture	to	serve.

water	as	needed
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Bring	a	medium	saucepan	of	water	to	boil.	Remove	from	heat.	Place	rice
vermicelli	in	boiling	water,	remove	from	heat,	and	let	soak	three	to	five	minutes,
until	soft.	Drain,	and	rinse	with	cool	water.
Step	2	Fill	a	huge	bowl	with	warm	water.	Dip	one	rice	wrapper	in	the	warm
water	for	1	second	to	soften.	Lay	wrapper	flat,	and	place	desired	levels	of
noodles,	shrimp,	carrot,	lettuce	and	basil	in	the	guts.	Roll	the	edges	of	the
wrapper	slightly	inward.	Beginning	in	the	bottom	edge	of	wrapper,	tightly	wrap
the	ingredients.	Repeat	with	remaining	ingredients.
Step	3	In	a	little	bowl,	mix	the	hoisin	sauce	with	water	until	desired	consistency
has	been	attained.	Heat	the	mixture	for	some	seconds	in	the	microwave.
Step	4	Serve	the	spring	rolls	with	the	warm	dipping	sauce.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese salad with crunchy noodles, serving 10 people. 

**Main Topics:**
- Recipe Title: Vietnamese Salad with Crunchy Noodles
- Servings: 10
- Ingredients: 
  - Long red chili
  - Caster sugar
  - Chinese cabbage (wombok)
  - Rice wine vinegar
  - Carrots
  - Mint leaves
  - Coriander leaves
  - Bean sprouts
  - Fried egg noodles

**Directions:**
1. Prepare a chili dressing by combining chili, rice wine vinegar, sugar, and salt in a saucepan, cooking until the sugar dissolves and the mixture reduces slightly.
2. Toss the remaining salad ingredients together and coat them with the chili dressing.
3. Serve immediately.

**Entities:**
- Ingredients: chili, sugar, cabbage, vinegar, carrots, mint, coriander, bean sprouts, egg noodles.
- Cooking methods: combining, cooking, tossing, serving.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	salad	with	crunchy	noodles
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
2	long	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
1/2	cup	caster	sugar
1	chinese	cabbage	(wombok),	finely	shredded	(a
mandolin	is	ideal)
1	cup	rice	wine	vinegar
2	carrots,	finely	shredded
2	cups	mint	leaves,	roughly	chopped
2	cups	coriander	leaves,	roughly	chopped
4	cups	bean	sprouts,	picked
200	g	fried	egg	noodles
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Combine	chilli,	rice	wine	vinegar	and	sugar	in	a	saucepan	with	1
tablespoon	salt.	Cook	over	medium	heat,	stirring	to	dissolve	the	sugar.	Increase
heat	and	simmer	for	2-3	minutes	to	slightly	reduce.	Set	aside	to	cool	completely.
Step	
2	Toss	all	the	remaining	ingredients	together,	then	add	the	chilli	dressing
and	toss	to	coat.	Serve	immediately.
Step	
3	Combine	chili,	rice	wine	vinegar,	and	sugar	in	a	saucepan	with	1
tablespoon	salt.	Cook	over	medium	heat,	stirring	to	dissolve	the	sugar.	Increase
heat	and	simmer	for	2-3	minutes	to	slightly	reduce.	Reserve	to	cool	completely.
Step		4	Toss	all	of	the	remaining	ingredients	together,	then	add	the	chili	dressing
and	toss	to	coat.	Serve	immediately.

   - French bread baguettes
   - Mayonnaise
   - Fresh lime juice
   - Red onions
   - Chile sauce with garlic
   - Cucumbers
   - Fresh cilantro
   - Salt and pepper

4. **Cooking Directions**: 
   - Preheating the oven's broiler

   - Assembling the sandwich with mayonnaise, pork, chile sauce, lime juice, onions, cucumbers, cilantro, salt, and pepper

**Entities**:
- **Food Items**: Pork, baguettes, mayonnaise, lime, onions, chile sauce, cucumbers, cilantro
- **Cooking Method**: Broiling, assembling a sandwich
- **Measurements**: Specific quantities for each ingredient (e.g., 6 chops, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise)

Overall, the section focuses on the preparation of a Vietnamese sandwich, highlighting the ingredients and step-by-step cooking instructions.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Sandwich
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
6	raw	chop	with	refuse,	195	g;	yields	excluding	refuses
boneless	pork	loin	chops,	cut	1/4	inch	thick
6	(7	inch)	french	bread	baguettes,	split	lengthwise
2	tablespoons	mayonnaise,	or	to	taste
6	tablespoons	fresh	lime	juice
1	1/2	small	red	onions,	sliced	into	rings
1	1/2	ounces	chile	sauce	with	garlic
1	1/2	medium	cucumbers,	peeled	and	sliced	lengthwise
3	tablespoons	chopped	fresh	cilantro
1	1/2	pinches	salt	and	pepper	to	taste
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Preheat	the	oven's	broiler.	Place	the	pork	chops	on	a	broiling	pan	and	set
beneath	the	broiler.	Cook	for	approximately	five	minutes,	turning	once,	or	until
browned	on	each	side.
Step	2	Open	the	French	rolls	and	spread	mayonnaise	on	the	insides.	Place	among
the	cooked	pork	chops	into	each	roll.	Spread	chile	sauce	on	the	meat.	Sprinkle
with	just	a	little	lime	juice	and	top	with	slices	of	onion,	cucumber,	cilantro,	salt
and	pepper.	Finish	with	another	quick	drizzle	of	lime	juice.

The section provides a recipe for a Spicy Beef and Noodle Salad, serving 10 people. Key ingredients include coles beef eye fillet, sweet chili sauce, vermicelli noodles, shredded carrots, fresh coriander, spring onions, mint leaves, lime, soy sauce, ginger, white sugar, and fish sauce. The preparation involves searing the beef, cooking it in the oven, soaking the noodles, and combining all ingredients. The dish is served with lime wedges and optional chili flakes. The cooking instructions are divided into steps, detailing the cooking process and preparation of the salad.

  - Sweet chili sauce
  - Vermicelli noodles
  - Carrots
  - Fresh herbs (coriander, mint)
  - Lime
  - Soy sauce
  - Ginger
  - Sugar
  - Fish sauce
- Cooking Instructions: 
  - Searing and baking beef
  - Preparing noodles
  - Combining ingredients
- Serving Suggestions: Lime wedges, chili flakes (optional)

__data__.text:
Spicy	beef	and	noodle	salad
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
800	pieces	g		coles	beef	eye	fillet
1/2	cup	coles	sweet	chilli	sauces
100	g	vermicelli	noodles

2	spring	onions,	sliced	diagonally
4	cups	mint	leaves

1/4	cup	ginger,	grated
2	tablespoons	white	sugar

chilli	flakes,	to	serve	(optional)
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	
1	Preheat	oven	to	200C	or	180C	fan.	Heat	an	ovenproof	frying	pan	on	high.
Cook	beef,	turning	for	2-3	mins,	or	until	seared	around.	Transfer	to	oven	and
cook	for	15	mins,	for	medium-rare,	or	until	cooked	to	your	liking.	Pour	sweet
chilli	sauce	over	beef,	embracing	coat.	Cover	loosely	with	foil	and	reserve	to	rest
for	20	mins.
Step	
2	Meanwhile,	place	noodles	in	a	heatproof	bowl.	Cover	with	boiling	water
and	soak,	according	to	packet	directions.	Drain.	Cut	noodles	into	6cm	lengths.
Step	
3	Thinly	slice	beef.	Place	noodles,	carrot,	mint,	coriander,	spring	onions

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Spring Rolls, detailing the ingredients and directions for preparation. 

**Main Topics:**
1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
2. **Servings**: 6

**Ingredients**:
- Dried rice noodles
- Rice wrappers
- Cooked medium shrimp
- Bean sprouts
- Fresh mint leaves
- Fish sauce
- Cilantro leaves

**Directions**:
1. Soak rice noodles in warm water until cooked, then drain and rinse.
2. Soak rice wrappers in warm water until softened.
3. Assemble rolls with mint, shrimp, noodles, bean sprouts, fish sauce, and cilantro.
4. Roll the wrappers burrito-style, folding in the sides and rolling tightly.

**Entities**:
- **Ingredients**: rice noodles, rice wrappers, shrimp, bean sprouts, mint, fish sauce, cilantro
- **Cooking Techniques**: soaking, rolling
- **Cuisine**: Vietnamese

Overall, the section outlines a simple and traditional method for making Vietnamese Spring Rolls, emphasizing fresh ingredients and straightforward preparation steps.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Spring	Rolls
	
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
3/8	(6.75	ounce)	package	dried	rice	noodle
6	eaches	rice	wrappers	(8.5	inch	diameter)
6	medium	(blank)s	cooked	medium	shrimp,	sliced	in
half	lengthwise
1	cup	bean	sprouts
3/4	cup	(blank)s	fresh	mint	leaves
2	tablespoons	fish	sauces,	or	to	taste
6	tablespoons	cilantro	leaves
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Place	the	rice	noodles	in	a	huge	bowl	of	warm	water	until	cooked,	about
quarter-hour.	Drain	and	rinse	with	cool	water.	Fill	a	huge	bowl	with	warm	water,
and	soak	the	rice	wrapper	sheets	individually	until	softened,	but	nonetheless
rather	firm;	about	20	seconds.	Place	the	sheets	on	a	huge	dish	cloth,	separate
from	one	another.	Place	a	mint	leaf	into	the	center	of	every	wrapper.	Place	two
shrimp	halves	over	the	mint	leaf,	top	with	a	little	couple	of	the	noodles,	and	5	to
6	bean	sprouts.	Season	to	taste	with	fish	sauce,	and	garnish	with	cilantro	leaves.
Step	2	Roll	them,	burrito	style,	by	folding	underneath	of	the	wrapper	over	the
completing	the	guts.	Fold	in	the	left	and	right	sides,	then	roll	the	whole	thing
from	you	tightly.

__data__.text:
Almost	instant	chicken	pho
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
60	g	dried	rice	vermicelli	noodles
2	massel	chicken	style	stock	cube,	crumbled
2	green	onions,	thinly	sliced
1	long	red	chilli,	thinly	sliced
1	1/3	cups	shredded	cooked	chicken
4	pieces	cm		fresh	ginger,	cut	into	thin	matchsticks
1	small	star	anise
1/2	lime
40	g	baby	spinach
40	g	bean	sprouts
3	tablespoons	fresh	coriander	leaves
3	tablespoons	fresh	thai	basil	leaves
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Roughly	split	up	noodles.	Place	noodles	in	a	3-cup-capacity	glass	jar	with
a	lid.	Top	with	a	stock	cube,	onion,	ginger,	chili,	and	chicken.	Place	star	anise
and	lime	at	the	top.	Secure	lid.	Refrigerate.	Place	spinach,	sprouts,	coriander,	and
basil	in	a	snap-lock	bag.	Refrigerate.
Step	
2	To	put	together:	Remove	lime	from	jar	and	reserve.	Pour	2	cups	boiling
water	into	the	jar.	Stir	until	stock	cube	has	dissolved.	Secure	lid.	Are	a	symbol	of
three	minutes	or	until	heated	through.	Discard	star	anise.	Stir	in	spinach	mixture.
Squeeze	lime	over	soup.	Serve.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese-style meatball sandwich, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

- **Dish Name**: Vietnamese-style meatball sandwich
- **Servings**: 10
- **Ingredients**: 
  - 1000 g lean beef mince
  - 1/4 cup crushed garlic
  - 2 tablespoons sriracha chili sauce (optional)
  - 4 cups finely chopped coriander roots and stems
  - 2 carrots (peeled and cut into ribbons)
  - 2 tablespoons white vinegar
  - 2 tablespoons sunflower oil
  - 1 teaspoon salt
  - 2 cucumbers (sliced into long batons)
  - 4 roma tomatoes (sliced)
  - Sprig of coriander (for serving)
  - 8 long bread rolls (split along the top)
  - Sriracha chili sauce (for serving)

- **Directions**: 
  1. Mix beef mince, garlic, sriracha, coriander, and salt; form into meatballs.
  2. Cook meatballs on a BBQ or grill until done.
  3. Pickle carrot ribbons in vinegar and salt for 10 minutes.
  4. Assemble the sandwich with salad, coriander, meatballs, and sauce.

Overall, the section outlines the ingredients and steps needed to prepare and serve the sandwich.

__data__.text:

Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1000	g	lean	beef	mince
1/4	cup	garlic,	crushed
2	tablespoons	sriracha	chilli	sauces	(optional)
4	cups	coriander,	root	and	stems	finely	chopped
2	carrots,	peeled	lengthways	into	ribbons
2	tablespoons	white	vinegar
2	tablespoons	sunflower	oil
1	teaspoon	salt
2	cucumbers,	sliced	lengthways	into	long	batons
4	roma	tomatoes,	sliced
sprig	coriander		,	to	serve
8	long	bread	rolls,	split	along	the	top
sriracha	chilli	sauce,	to	serve
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	
1	Place	the	beef	mince,	garlic,	sriracha,	and	coriander	root	and	stems	in	a
huge	bowl	with	½	teaspoon	salt	and	mix	to	mix,	using	clean	hands.	Roll	a
heaped	tablespoon	of	mince	mixture	right	into	a	meatball.	Repeat	to	create	16
meatballs.
Step	
2	Place	3-4	meatballs	per	skewer,	brush	with	oil	and	cook	on	a	BBQ,	grill
pan	or	large	non	stick	fry-pan	over	medium	heat	until	cooked	through.

3	To	pickle	carrot,	place	carrot	ribbons	in	a	bowl	with	vinegar	and	salt	and

4	Place	just	a	little	salad	and	coriander	in	each	roll,	top	with	meatballs	and
drizzle	with	sauce	to	serve.

over	high	temperature.	Add	oil,	then	add	prawns	within	a	layer	and	cook,

**Main Topics:**
1. **Ingredients**: The recipe lists various ingredients including salt-reduced gluten-free soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, olive oil, chicken mince, ginger, sweet potato noodles, red chili, coriander root, snow peas, red onions, cherry tomatoes, coriander leaves, and mixed salad leaves.
2. **Directions**: The cooking process is outlined in three steps:
   - Combine the soy sauce, lime juice, and sugar; prepare the sweet potato noodles.
   - Stir-fry the chicken with ginger, chili, and coriander root until browned and aromatic.
   - Mix in the vegetables and noodles with the soy sauce mixture, then serve on salad leaves.

**Entities:**
- **Dish Name**: Warm Vietnamese Chicken Salad
- **Servings**: 10
- **Key Ingredients**: Chicken mince, sweet potato noodles, fresh vegetables (snow peas, red onions, cherry tomatoes), and herbs (coriander).
- **Cooking Techniques**: Combining, microwaving, stir-frying, and tossing. 

Overall, the section emphasizes a healthy, flavorful salad that incorporates fresh ingredients and a quick cooking method.

__data__.text:
Warm	Vietnamese	chicken	salad
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/3	cups	salt-reduced	gluten-free	soy	sauce
2	tablespoons	fresh	lime	juice
2	teaspoons	brown	sugar
2	teaspoons	extra	virgin	olive	oil
1000	g	lilydale	free	range	chicken	mince
1	1/2	tablespoons	finely	grated	fresh	ginger
500	g	pkt	fresh	sweet	potato	noodles
2	long	fresh	red	chilli,	finely	chopped
2	tablespoons	chopped	fresh	coriander	root
400	g	snow	peas,	sliced
2	red	onions,	thinly	sliced
500	g	cherry	tomatoes,	halved
1/4	cup	chopped	fresh	coriander	leaves
200	g	mixed	salad	leaves
	
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	
1	Combine	the	soy	sauce,	lime	juice,	and	sugar	in	a	little	bowl.	Microwave
the	sweet	potato	noodles	following	packet	directions.
Step	
2	Heat	oil	in	a	huge	wok	over	high	temperature.	Stir-fry	chicken,	stirring
with	a	wooden	spoon	to	split	up	any	lumps,	for	five	minutes	or	until	browned.
Add	ginger,	chilli	and	coriander	root.	Stir-fry	for	an	additional	1-2	minutes	or
until	aromatic.	Remove	from	heat.
Step	
3	Add	snow	pea,	onion,	tomato,	coriander	leaves,	sweet	potato	noodles	and
soy	sauce	mixture.	Gently	toss	to	mix.	Divide	salad	leaves	among	serving	plates.
Top	with	the	warm	chicken	mixture.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for "Vietnamese Lemongrass Beef and Noodles," serving six people. Key topics and entities include:

- **Dish Name**: Vietnamese Lemongrass Beef and Noodles
- **Servings**: 6
- **Ingredients**: 
  - Rice vermicelli noodles
  - Lemongrass
  - Soy-based liquid seasonings (e.g., Maggi®)
  - Brown sugar
  - Garlic
  - Dry sherry
  - Flank steak
  - Warm water
  - White sugar
  - Lemon juice
  - Fish sauce
  - Fresh red Thai chile peppers
  - Thai basil leaves
  - Cilantro
  - Fresh bean sprouts
- **Directions**: 
  - Step 1: Cook the vermicelli noodles, drain, and rinse.
  - Step 2: Marinate the flank steak with a mixture of lemongrass, soy-based seasoning, sherry, brown sugar, and garlic for thirty minutes.

The section includes details on preparation methods and ingredient quantities.

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	Lemongrass	Beef	and	Noodles
Servings:	6
	
	
Ingredients
	
1	1/2	(8-ounce)	packages	rice	vermicelli	noodles
1/2	cup	minced	lemongrass
3	tablespoons	soy-based	liquid	seasonings	(such	as
maggi®)
1	1/2	tablespoons	brown	sugar
4	1/2	tablespoons	garlic,	minced
1	1/2	tablespoons	dry	sherry
1	1/2	pounds	flank	steak,	thinly	sliced
3	tablespoons	warm	water,	or	more	as	needed
3	tablespoons	white	sugar
3/4	medium	lemon,	juiced
6	tablespoons	fish	sauces
3	eaches	fresh	red	thai	chile	peppers,	minced
3	tablespoons	garlic,	finely	minced
3	cups	thai	basil	leaves,	chopped,	or	to	taste
3	cups	cilantro,	chopped,	or	to	taste
1	1/2	cups	fresh	bean	sprouts,	or	to	taste
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Bring	a	sizable	pot	of	water	to	a	boil.	Add	vermicelli	noodles	and	cook
until	softened,	12	minutes.	Drain	noodles	and	rinse	with	cool	water,	stirring	to
split	up	the	noodles.	Reserve.
Step	2	Combine	lemongrass,	soy-based	seasoning,	sherry,	brown	sugar,	and
garlic	in	a	bowl.	Marinate	flank	steak	in	mixture,	tossing	evenly,	and	let	sit	for
thirty	minutes.

metadata.section_summary:
The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese dish that involves preparing a turkey soup with rice noodles. The main topics and entities include:

1. **Ingredients**:
   - Turkey carcass
   - Water
   - Sachet (likely containing herbs and spices)
   - Ginger
   - Onion
   - Rice noodles
   - Fish sauce
   - Salt
   - Fresh herbs (basil, cilantro)
   - Lime
   - Hot sauce

2. **Cooking Steps**:
   - **Step 1**: Char ginger and onion in a skillet.
   - **Step 2**: Combine turkey carcass, water, sachet, ginger, and onion in a pot, bring to a boil, then simmer for 2 hours.
   - **Step 3**: Cook rice noodles in salted boiling water until firm to the bite, then drain.
   - **Step 4**: Remove carcass and strain the soup. Season with fish sauce and salt, then serve the soup over noodles and turkey meat, garnished with herbs, lime, and hot sauce.

3. **Cooking Techniques**:
   - Charring
   - Boiling
   - Simmering
   - Straining

Overall, the section outlines a method for making a flavorful turkey soup with rice noodles, highlighting the importance of seasoning and garnishing for enhanced flavor.

The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese limeade, serving 10 people. The main topics include:

- **Ingredients**: The recipe requires lime juice, ice cubes, caster sugar, and chilled soda water.
- **Directions**: The preparation involves dividing sugar between glasses, mixing it with lime juice, crushing ice, and adding it to the glasses before topping with soda water.

Key entities include:
- **Dish**: Vietnamese limeade
- **Servings**: 10
- **Main Ingredients**: Lime juice, ice, caster sugar, soda water
- **Preparation Steps**: Mixing, crushing ice, serving

__data__.text:
Vietnamese	limeade
	
Servings:	10
	
	
Ingredients
	
1/2	cup	lime	juice	(see	tip)
2	cups	ice	cubes
1/2	cup	caster	sugar
3	cups	soda	water,	chilled
	
	
	
	
Directions
Step	1	Divide	sugar	between	two	1	1/2	cup-capacity	chilled	glasses.	Top	with
lime	juice.	Utilizing	a	metal	spoon,	stir	to	mix.
Step	
2	Place	ice	in	a	snap-lock	bag.	Wrap	in	a	tea	towel.	Utilizing	a	rolling	pin,
gently	crush.	Divide	between	glasses.	Stir	to	mix.	Top	with	soda	water.	Serve.

The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese pork kebabs, serving 10 people. Key topics and entities include:

- **Dish Name**: Vietnamese Pork Kebabs
- **Servings**: 10
- **Ingredients**:
  - 800g pork mince
  - 1/2 cup dried breadcrumbs
  - 8 garlic cloves (crushed)
  - 4 eschalots (peeled and finely chopped)
  - 500g dried rice vermicelli noodles
  - 2/3 cup Vietnamese dipping sauces (for spring rolls)
  - 1/4 cup fish sauce
  - 2/3 cup lemon juice
  - 1/2 iceberg lettuce (shredded)
  - 2 cups chopped fresh mint leaves
  - 2 cups chopped fresh coriander leaves

- **Directions**:
  1. Combine pork mince, breadcrumbs, garlic, eschalots, and half the fish sauce; shape around skewers.
  2. Cook noodles, drain, and mix with dipping sauce, lemon juice, and remaining fish sauce.
  3. Preheat barbecue or chargrill and cook skewers for 8 minutes.
  4. Toss lettuce, mint, and coriander with noodle mixture and serve with skewers.

Overall, the section details the ingredients and preparation steps for making Vietnamese pork kebabs, highlighting the use of fresh herbs and a dipping sauce.

2. **Preparing the Rice Noodles**: Boil water, rinse the rice noodles, and cook them until they are partially tender. Add bean sprouts to the noodles and continue cooking until everything is tender yet firm.

3. **Combining Ingredients**: Mix the cooked noodles with the pork mixture in a serving dish and top with fresh vegetables and herbs, including lettuce, green onion, basil, cilantro, and crispy chow mein.

The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese caramel beef, serving 10 people. Key components include:

**Ingredients:**
- Peanut oil
- Australian beef scotch fillet
- Garlic
- Red onions
- Brown sugar
- Fresh ginger
- Fish sauce
- Lime juice
- Red chili
- Chopped coriander
- Steamed jasmine rice (for serving)
- Butter lettuce leaves (for serving)
- Lime wedges (for serving)

**Directions:**
1. Heat oil in a frying pan and cook the beef until browned, then add garlic, ginger, and onion.
2. Prepare a sauce by dissolving sugar in water, then adding fish sauce and lime juice. Combine with the beef mixture and heat through.
3. Serve with chili, coriander, rice, lettuce leaves, and lime wedges.

- Fresh lime juice and soy sauce

**Summary:**

- **Recipe Title:** Prawns with Tomato & Tamarind
- **Servings:** 10

**Ingredients:**
- Passata (tomato pasta sauce) - 185ml (3/4 cup)
- Massel chicken-style liquid stock - 125ml (1/2 cup)
- Caster sugar - 2 tablespoons
- Fish sauce - 1 1/2 tablespoons
- Tamarind puree - 2 tablespoons
- Vegetable oil - 2 tablespoons
- Garlic cloves - 4, finely chopped
- Fresh red chili - 2, finely chopped
- Green prawns - 1600g, peeled (tails intact) and deveined
- Steamed rice (for serving)
- Fresh coriander sprigs (for serving)

**Directions:**
1. Combine passata, stock, tamarind, sugar, and fish sauce in a jug.
2. Heat oil in a wok, stir-fry garlic and chili until aromatic, then add prawns and stir-fry until they change color.
3. Add the passata mixture and simmer until thickened. Serve over rice and garnish with coriander. 

**Key Topics:**
- Cooking method: Stir-frying and simmering
- Cuisine: Vietnamese
- Main ingredients: Prawns, tomato, tamarind, and spices
- Serving suggestion: With steamed rice and fresh coriander.

The section provides a recipe for Vietnamese Pho Ga (Chicken Pho) and includes the following main topics and entities:

1. **Recipe Title**: Vietnamese Pho Ga (Chicken Pho)
2. **Servings**: 6
3. **Ingredients**:
   - Dried rice noodles (3/4 package, 16-ounce)
   - Whole chicken (3/4)
   - Whole star anise (1 1/2 each)
   - Monosodium glutamate (MSG) (3/8 teaspoon)
   - Peeled ginger (2-inch piece)
   - Salt (1 1/2 teaspoons)
   - Water (3 cups, to cover)
4. **Directions**:
   - Soak noodles in cool water for about 30 minutes.
   - Cook chicken with ginger, star anise, MSG, salt, and water over medium heat for about 40 minutes until cooked through.
   - Cool and shred the chicken after cooking.
   - Boil water and cook the noodles until tender (1-2 minutes), then drain.
   - Serve noodles topped with shredded chicken and ladle in broth.

The section provides a recipe for a Vietnamese-style meatball sandwich, serving 10 people. The main topics and entities include:

- **Dish Name**: Vietnamese-style meatball sandwich
- **Servings**: 10
- **Ingredients**: 
  - 1000 g lean beef mince
  - 1/4 cup crushed garlic
  - 2 tablespoons sriracha chili sauce (optional)
  - 4 cups finely chopped coriander roots and stems
  - 2 carrots (peeled and cut into ribbons)
  - 2 tablespoons white vinegar
  - 2 tablespoons sunflower oil
  - 1 teaspoon salt
  - 2 cucumbers (sliced into long batons)
  - 4 roma tomatoes (sliced)
  - Sprig of coriander (for serving)
  - 8 long bread rolls (split along the top)
  - Sriracha chili sauce (for serving)

- **Directions**: 
  1. Mix beef mince, garlic, sriracha, coriander, and salt; form into meatballs.
  2. Cook meatballs on a BBQ or grill until done.
  3. Pickle carrot ribbons in vinegar and salt for 10 minutes.
  4. Assemble the sandwich with salad, coriander, meatballs, and sauce.
